title: square_enix
body:
[b]Square Enix Holdings Co., Ltd.[/b] is a Japanese video game developer, publisher, and distribution company that is best known for its [[Final Fantasy]], [[Dragon Quest]], and [[Kingdom Hearts]] role-playing video game franchises, among numerous others. Several of them have sold over 10 million copies worldwide, with the Final Fantasy franchise alone selling over 115 million.

The original Square Enix Co., Ltd. was formed as the result of a merger between Enix Corporation and Square Co., Ltd. in April 2003, with Enix legally absorbing Square. In 2009, they acquired Eidos Interactive Limited, which was renamed to Square Enix Europe. This branch oversees the company's western studios and franchises.

h4. Franchises

* [[Bravely Default (series)|]]
* [[Chrono Trigger]]
* [[Deus Ex]]
* [[Dragon Quest]]

title: pixiv_sample
body:
A image from Pixiv that is an [[image sample]], rather than the original image.

This tag is automatically added by a bot to any Pixiv post that is detected to be a sample. Do not add this tag unless you can confirm a difference, or remove it unless the hashes match.

To avoid uploading a sample, paste a link to the image on the upload page, rather than downloading the image to your computer then uploading it.

Sample images contain "/img-master/" in the URL. Original images contain "/img-original/".
Opening a pixiv image with "Open image in new tab" always gives an image sample URL. After logging in to pixiv, you can get the original image URL by 
pressing "Open link in new tab". 

h4. Examples

* Sample: https://i.pximg.net/img-master/img/2025/01/29/22/49/45/126697322_p0_master1200.jpg (1200x1200 1.02 MB .jpg)
* Original: https://i.pximg.net/img-original/img/2025/01/29/22/49/45/126697322_p0.png (2000x2000 4.97 MB .png)

h4. See also

* [[Bad Pixiv ID]]
* [[MD5 Mismatch]]
* [[Image Sample]]
* [[Howto:Pixiv]]

title: guest_art
body:
[[Official art]] created by a guest artist. Either commissioned by a copyright holder or is [[gift art|gifted]] to the author of the work by other established artist.

This is often seen in the end matter for published manga or books (e.g. alongside the work's primary artist's afterword), or featured in [[end card]]s or [[eyecatch]]es in animated works, or in specially produced extra content, officially sanctioned [[promotional art]], and the like.

Don't use this tag for images posted in [[artist collaboration|collaborative]] works where no one artist dominates the artwork, even if one artist officially edits and publishes the work and/or solicits work from other artists.

h4. See also
* [[gift art]]
* Pool #1338 ("Popular Artists Draw Other Copyrights")

title: hagikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hagikaze[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Hayami Saori]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and tied [[one side up]], and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-designed [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with a black [[vest]], [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]], [[grey_socks|grey]]/[[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and [[loafers]], plus [[purple bra|purple]] underwear as revealed in her damaged CG. Each class member has a different color for their neckwear, hers is [[red ribbon|red]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back with 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] and a 12.7 twin gun mount, a second 12.7 cm twin mount as a [[handgun]], and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on [[thigh strap]]s.

title: kuroshio_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kuroshio[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by voiced by [[Fujita Saki]].

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[hairclip]] on the left side, and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-style [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform: a [[black vest]], [[white shirt]], [[bike shorts]] [[shorts_under_skirt|under]] the [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]], [[grey socks|grey kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Each class member has a different color for their [[neck ribbon]]: hers is [[blue ribbon|blue]]/[[black ribbon|black]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with her Konishi-designed sisters: her real-life bridge to her back with a 12.7 cm twin gun mount and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] attached, a second 12.7 cm twin mount as a [[handgun]], and [[thigh strap]]s containing a 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] and [[depth charge]]s.

Speaks in [[kansaiben|Kansai-ben]].

title: hayashio_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hayashio[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by Kogawa Miona.

In-game, she is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and a [[mole_under_eye|mole under her right eye]], Her default outfit is the standard Konishi-designed [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform: a [[black vest]], [[white shirt]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], [[loafers]], and [[white gloves]]. Each class member has a different color for their [[neck ribbon]], hers is [[blue ribbon|blue]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a bridge accessory to her back, holding her 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her left and a 12.7 cm twin gun mount to her right, while she uses a second 12.7 twin gun mount and a 25 mm twin anti-air mount as two separate [[handgun|handguns]].

She later gains [[Hayashio Kai Ni (Kancolle)|her kai ni]] on July 13, 2022, upon the end of the Spring 2022 event that she debuted in.

title: clamp_(circle)
body:
Stylized as CLAMP, a collective of 4 mangaka famous for their works such as [[Cardcaptor Sakura]] and [[Chobits]]. The group started out with 11 members in 1986; as of 1993 the circle consists of [[Nekoi Tsubaki]], [[Ookawa Nanase]], [[Mokona (clamp)|]], and [[Igarashi Satsuki]].

Notorious for characters featuring abnormally long limbs.

title: himouto!_umaru-chan
body:
A 2013-to-present seinen comedy manga by [[Sankakuhead]], with a summer 2015 anime adaptation and fall 2017 season 2 anime by [[Doga Kobo]]. An alternative version of the manga was serialized for 2 chapters in 2012 before its current serialization.

The term [i]himouto[/i] (干物妹) in the title is a merger of the term [i]himono onna[/i] (干物女, "dried fish woman", referring to fish jerky junk food snacks that replace home-cooked meals) and the word [i]imouto[/i] (妹, "younger sister"). [i]Himono onna[/i] was coined by the manga [[hotaru_no_hikari_(manga)|Hotaru no Hikari]], and refers to a young woman who leads a stable career but has little to no interest in romance and is generally reclusive, typically at home when not having to go out for her job. Her public and private lives are generally very different, with her public appearance being very clean, organized, and well-mannered. In contrast, her private appearance is messy, disorganized, and ill-mannered.

h4. Characters

* [[Doma Umaru]] ([[Komaru (himouto! umaru-chan)|]] / [[UMR (himouto! umaru-chan)|]])
* [[Doma Taihei]]
* [[Ebina Nana]]

* [[Motoba Takeshi]]

* [[Kongou Hikari]]

h4. External links

title: isuzu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Isuzu[/i]. Character design by [[Ootsuki Momiji]], voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied to a [[side ponytail]] on her right, [[brown eyes]], and [[horns]]. 

Her default outfit at base form consists of a [[sleeves past fingers|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], grey [[collar]] with a [[sakuramon]], an [[oversized clothes|oversized]] [[brown sweater]] worn partially [[off shoulder]], [[black pantyhose]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], [[rudder footwear|rudders]], and an orange [[hair bow]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast with a [[radar]] set plus two 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and two hull pieces containing 127 mm twin gun mounts.

title: ruan_mei_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[blue eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue dress]] with a [[pelvic curtain]], [[blue gloves]], single [[DNA]]-themed [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, [[blue footwear|blue]] [[high heels]], and a [[pearl necklace]]. She is also seen with a [[ruan]], her namesake instrument.

title: frankfurt_(city)
body:
Frankfurt, a central German city on the river Main, is a major financial hub that's home to the European Central Bank. 

It's the birthplace of famed writer Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, whose former home is now the Goethe House Museum.

Like much of the city, it was damaged during [[World War II]] and later rebuilt. The reconstructed Altstadt (Old Town) is the site of the Römerberg, a square that hosts an annual Christmas market.

title: shana
body:
Shana is the main heroine of the [[Shakugan no Shana]] media franchise.

She is the Flame Haze bound as contractor to the Crimson God [[Alastor (Shakugan no Shana)|Alastor]]; their job is to stop other Crimson Denizens from running amok. The series begins when she gets involved with [[Sakai Yuuji]], an ordinary high schooler who's been imbued with a powerful artifact that can't fall into the wrong hands. Shana becomes his protector, and gradually more like a partner as he learns to fight; in turn, sharing daily life with Yuuji gradually brings Shana out of her shell (she's always lived in the world of Flame Haze, to the point of not even bothering with a [i]name[/i] till Yuuji gives her one).

Shana is often seen wearing a [[pendant]], the vessel of Alastor, and wielding the [[sword]] she's named after, the Nietono no Shana. She sports [[long hair]] ([[black hair|black]] normally, [[red hair|red]] with a flame effect when she's fighting), an [[ahoge]], and [[zettai ryouiki]]. Her closest connections are with Alastor (partner and advisor), Yuuji (love interest), [[Yoshida Kazumi]] (friend/love rival), and [[Wilhelmina Carmel]] (mother figure). Her love for [[melon bread]] is the stuff of legend.

While not the first [[tsundere]] character, Shana is rivalled only by [[Tohsaka Rin]] for most famous one.

h4. See also

* [[Burning Arisa]]

h4. External links

* "Shakugan no Shana Wiki: Shana":https://shakugan.fandom.com/wiki/Shana

title: sanguophage_(rimworld)
body: Sanguophages are an exceptionally rare and powerful xenotype with a deathly intolerance to heat and sunlight. They use their superhuman powers to satiate their genetic need for human blood, being RimWorld's equivalent to vampires. They were first introduced in RimWorld's third DLC, Biotech.

title: gato_(snk)
body:
A character from [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]] series. He made his debut in [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]] as a newcomer, makes a returning appearance in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], and made several appearances in [[The King of Fighters]] series.

Gato is an intense martial artist trained in [[kung fu]] who seeks vengeance against his father Gaoh for the death of his mother. He is constantly being chased by his younger sister, [[Futaba Hotaru|Hotaru Futaba]], who just wants him to come home; he evades her to keep her safe and out of his business. In his arcade ending in Garou:MotW, he is blinded by a sneak attack from Gaoh; in the two years since and going into FF:CotW, his vision has more or less healed, but the encounter revealed a perceived weakness of his, so now he willingly fights blind.

title: frutiger_aero
body:
Frutiger Aero is a visual aesthetic primarily utilized in the 2000s to early 2010s for commerical purposes, focusing on the mix of nature with technology, as well as an overall "glossy" look.

The name, coined by the Consumer Aesthetics Research Institute, originates from the "Aero" style from [[Windows 7]], and the Frutiger font.

Color palettes tend to consist of whites, blues and greens, and the occasional orange. Glossy textures are very common, as are semi-transparent elements. [[Lens flare]]s and [[bokeh]] are also frequently seen, along with "swirly" freeform shapes.

Common thematic elements include colorful [[tropical fish]] and other marine life (often jumping out of a body of shimmering blue [[water]]), [[glass]], bright green [[grass]], [[bubble]]s, the [[aurora]] phenomenon, [[blue sky|blue skies]], technology of the time period (i.e. [[flip phone]]s, 2000s [[computer]]s, [[digital media player]]s), and contemporary and retrofuturistic architecture.

h4. Examples
* !post #7016487 
* !post #3078769
* !post #755036
* !post #754662

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Frutiger Aero":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frutiger_Aero
* "Aesthetics Wiki: Frutiger Aero":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Frutiger_Aero (Aesthetic Wiki)
* "Frutiger-Aero.org":https://frutiger-aero.org/frutiger-aero

h4. See also

* [[Frutiger Metro]]
* [[Vaporwave]]
other_names: フルティガー・エアロ

title: terry_bogard
body:
Main character of the [[Fatal Fury]] series and a regular in [[The King of Fighters]]. His [i]nom de guerre[/i] is the "(Legendary) Hungry Wolf".

Terry is an American street fighter, trained in Hakkyokuseiken and a mish-mash of various martial arts. He is the [[brothers|elder brother]] to [[Andy Bogard]] and friends with [[Joe Higashi]], [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]], and [[Blue Mary]] among many others, mortal enemy of [[Geese Howard]] - the South Town crime lord who murdered his and Andy's father Jeff Bogard, and adoptive father and mentor to Geese's bastard son [[Rock Howard]]. He is one of the biggest folk heroes of South Town, a fictional coastal American metropolis inspired by Miami, Florida.

Terry is one of [[SNK]]'s chief ambassadors, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions on top of being an all-around very popular character and important to the landscape of video games. He achieved his [[meme|memetic]] status in part through his "engrish" quotes said during gameplay.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3618604: Classic Terry
* !post #6191180: Time-skip Terry
* !post #3211344: Heroine Terry

He mostly wears a red leather [[vest]] that has a [[star (symbol)|]] on the back, a [[baseball cap]] that matches his vest, a white T-shirt (later replaced by a [[tank top]] of the same color), blue [[jeans]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]], and [[fingerless gloves]]. His [[blonde hair]] is mainly done in a [[ponytail]].

In [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], however, Terry begins to [[hair down|untie his hair]] without his cap and starts wearing a brown [[bomber jacket]], while retaining his jeans and gloves.

h4. Known moves

* [[Buster Wolf]]
* [[Power Geyser]]
* [[Power Wave]]
* [[Rising Tackle]]

Two long side flaps come down from the hat and end in paws. When one of these paw flaps is pressed or pulled on, the respective ear flips upward.

title: oekaki
body:
A drawing made with very simple tools, usually imageboard/bbs-embedded drawing software, with very sharp and thin lines.

Oekaki (お絵描き) is Japanese for "scribble" or "doodle". On the Internet, an Oekaki is a message board system that revolves around computer art created by a local art program. Oekaki artists often post their art to other websites, such as personal pages or free gallery websites, in addition to the original board.

h4. See also

* [[stickam]]
* [[tegaki]]

title: chou_tengen_toppa_gurren-lagann
body:
The largest mecha in the [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] series, introduced in [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann: Lagann-hen|Lagann-hen]], Chou Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann is a manifestation of pure [[Spiral Power]], vaguely resembling both [[Kamina (ttgl)|]] and [[Simon (ttgl)|]], created with the fusion of all the Tengen Toppa Gunmen. It is at least 50 times larger than [[Tengen Toppa Gurren-Lagann (mecha)|]], approaching the size of a galactic cluster, thus making it one of the largest mecha in anime to date.

Its signature attack, [i]Chou Tengen Toppa Giga Drill Breaker[/i], is several times larger and more powerful still than the mecha itself, enough to infinitely distort the Anti-Spiral's dimension and destroy it as a result.

h4. See also

* [[Gurren-Lagann]]
* [[Arc Gurren-Lagann]]
* [[Chouginga Gurren-Lagann]]
* [[Tengen Toppa Gurren-Lagann (mecha)|]]

h4. External links

title: pussy_blush
body:
The redness is due to the dilation of the blood vessels, which increases the amount of blood that passes through them. In this way, they acquire a deep red color.

Just like on the face or neck, the vagina suffers a similar redness. This tag must be used when there is a blush in that area or near it

Depending on the character's species, the Blush can change from being red to the equivalent of said species. Use this tag in that situation as well.

title: manjoume_fumi
body:
One of main characters of [[Aoi Hana]] manga series. 

A first-year student at Matsuoka Girl's High School. She is seen by other girls as being strong, refined and gentle, however they're surprised when they realize that Fumi is actually very gentle and shy. Others have noted her for having pretty eyes and a soft, lady-like voice. She is often said to make "scary faces" when she is upset or irked. Despite her size, mature aura and sometimes foreboding presence, Fumi is somehow prone to crying.

After moving back to her home town, she quickly becomes friends with a girl from her youth: Okudaira Akira. Fumi used to live near Akira while growing up, the two being best friends from the young ages of five or six. Fumi relied heavily on Akira in kindergarten, as she is seen incapable of doing anything but crying until Akira comes to "save" her and take care of her. This has not changed much as she got older, as noted by Akira.

title: grand_dad
body:
A [[meme]] character originating from [[Vinesauce]]'s [[Joel (vinesauce)|]], as a result of him reacting to a Taiwanese bootleg of [i][[The Flintstones]]: The Rescue of Dino & Hoppy[/i] known as [b]7 GRAND DAD[/b]. A character popularized by and associated since with [[SiIvaGunner]].

As a character, Grand Dad has two appearances: the first, more well-known, appears on the title screen of the bootleg, where he is depicted as a knockoff of [[Mario]], utilizing the same sprite as [[Fortran (dian shi ma li)|]] from [i][[Dian Shi Ma Li]][/i] but recolored and with an '王' on his hat rather than an F; the second lesser-known is his gameplay sprite, which replaces [[Fred Flintstone]]'s head with that of Mario.

title: chamber_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 4
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can add 1 "Dragonmaid" Spell/Trap from your Deck to your hand. At the start of the Battle Phase: You can return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 7 or higher "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Chamber Dragonmaid" once per turn. [/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1800


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Initially being the only member of the archetype that do not have a draconic form until the release of [[Dragonmaid Stern]] in 2024. As indicated by her name, her duty is cleaning and preparing the house's bedchambers. She is also depicted using a feather duster and a mop made up of her [[feathered wings]]. 

Chamber is often depicted as being shy in multiple fan arts may be from her emotion from card artworks. In the Card Game Art Works, she is described being bad at expressing herself. Later, Chamber is later depicted as being a jealous senior due to the debut of [[Lattice Dragonmaid]] completely overshadow the addition of her dragon form.

title: super_robot_wars_original_generation
body:
A subseries of [[Super Robot Wars]] that combines the original characters, [[mecha]], and plot elements from the crossover games into new titles featuring only Banpresto originals. Original characters and units from other Banpresto crossover games appear in the series as well.

The first game in the series was released on [[Game Boy Advance]] in 2002 and featured two playable routes, one following [[Ryuusei Date]] as the main protagonist and the other following [[Kyousuke Nanbu]]. OG1 and [[Super Robot Wars Original Generation 2]] were remade into a single game in [b]Super Robot Wars Original Generations[/b], which was released for [[PlayStation 2]] in 2007.

OG1 introduces the original elements from the following entries:
* The 2nd SRW
* Hero Chronicles: Project Olympus
* The 3rd SRW
* The 4th SRW
* Super Hero Operations
* [[Super Robot Wars Alpha 1]]
* Super Robot Wars Compact 2 - Part 1
* Super Robot Wars Compact 2 - Part 2

title: van_darkholme
body:
A Vietnamese-American former gay pornographic actor and director. Best known for his [[BDSM]] works.

In the [[NicoNico]] and [[Gachimuchi]] fanbase, he is popular next to [[Billy Herrington]] as an internet [[meme]]. In Chinese [[Bilibili]], he is the most popular Gachimuchi character.

Japanese fans call him [b]TDN (TaDaNo) Kosugi[/b] (in reference to [[Tadano Kazuhito]] from [[Manatsu no yo no Inmu]]) or [b]Van-sama[/b], while Chinese fans often call him as [b]Dungeon Master[/b]

His sound was used in almost every Gachimuchi video as instrumental, including his famous phrase [[leatherclub scene (meme)|"Fuck You"]] that he replied to [[Mark Wolff]] after getting mocked for his [[bdsm|leather]] outfit.

His popularity in China is very high, to the point that he was invited to SKY Anime festival in Shanghai, China, in 2019. He's also created his official Bilibili and Twitch account as well.


h4. See also

* [[Mark Wolff]]
* [[Billy Herrington]]

title: doro_(nikke)
body:
A [[meme]] character based on [[Dorothy (nikke)|]] from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. Has also been referred to as "Dororong", "Dororo", and "La creatura" (a nickname it shares with [[Neco-Arc]]). Its appearance was based on a peculiar fanart of [[Stella Unibell]] from [[Soulworker]] as a chibi dog.

It originated from the Korean NIKKE "forums":[https://arca.live/e/33292?target=tag&keyword=%EB%8B%88%EC%BC%80&p=] but has quickly spread to other communities such as [[Blue Archive]], [[Honkai: Star Rail]], and [[Hololive]]. The meme also gained attention from the developers themselves, Shift Up with the CEO, [[Kim Hyung Tae]] and his wife [[KKUEM]] are "seen holding a Santa-esque Doro plush alongside Shuhei Yoshida":[https://x.com/yosp/status/1778902056721592730]. The 2024 April Fools event for the game also features [[Matis (nikke)|Matis]] in the form of Doro as [[Syuen (nikke)|]]'s burst skill.

Note that this tag is also applicable to any other characters that got "Dorofication" treatment, not just Dorothy's Doro.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Dororong":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/dororong]

title: dutch_angle
body:
An image that is framed at a tilted angle. Often used to fit tall characters into a wide image. The technique may also be used to make an image appear more dynamic or visually interesting.

The term originates in filmmaking, and is also known as the German angle or Batman angle.

Basically if you find yourself tilting your head to one side in order to see the picture in proper perspective, this tag is appropriate.

h4. Examples

* !post #4243732: Dutch angle
* !post #4243734: No dutch angle

h4. See also

* [[perspective]]
* [[fisheye]]
* [[Tag group:Image Composition]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dutch angle":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dutch_angle]

title: arius_squad_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], Arius Squad is one of the clubs at Arius Satellite School.

An elite team formerly consisting of five members hand-picked by Beatrice, yet only seen by her as mere pawns ready to be disposed of at any time. Commonly referred to as Squad, they were responsible for the assassination attempt of [[Seia (blue archive)|]] and the attack during the signing of the Eden Treaty. [spoilers]If [[Azusa (blue archive)|]] is also present, please add [[spoilers]].[/spoilers]
 
Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

h4. Members

body:
Italian for "frozen," in English, it specifically refers to a style of soft rich [[ice cream]] that originated from Italy.   Unlike American-style ice cream that legally contains up to 50% air, gelato contains between 25-35% air and contains less butterfat typically found in standard ice creams.

body:
The default battlesuit/outfit of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[elysia_(honkai_impact)|Elysia]]. Reflects her initial appearance in the Elysian Realm. 

Her "Miss Pink Elf" outfit consists of a [[strapless]] [[white shirt]] top, [[black shrug]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on her left hand. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #5884582: Default
* !post #5304020: Default (armed)
* !post #6232866: [[elysia (summer miss elf) (honkai impact)|Summer Miss Elf♪]]
* !post #5578564: [[elysia (miss pink) (honkai impact)|Miss Pink♪]]
* !asset #24688641: [[elysia (xmas cottage) (honkai impact)|XMas Cottage]]

title: elysia_(coco)_(honkai_impact)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[elysia (honkai impact)|Elysia]] for "Coco bubble tea chain collaboration in mainland China":[https://www.miyoushe.com/bh3/article/43875106]. 

It consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], [[black bowtie]], [[black skirt|black]] [[double-breasted]] [[underbust]] [[high-waist skirt]] with [[suspender skirt|suspender]], blue-yellow [[gradient clothes|gradient]] [[shawl]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. Worth noting is that the color scheme and base design elements are reminiscent of [[March 7th (honkai: star rail)|]]'s [[March 7th (Preservation) (Honkai: Star Rail)|default outfit]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #6785422

title: elysia_(summer_2023)_(honkai_impact)
body:
The original [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Elysia (honkai impact)|]], exclusive to her [[Elysia (Herrscher of Human: Ego) (Honkai Impact)|Herrscher of Human: Ego]] form. 

Originally released as part of the game's Summer merchandise lineup for 2023, her outfit consists of a [[frilled bikini|frilled]] [[purple bikini|purple]] [[multi-strapped bikini bottom|multi-strapped bikini]] with a [[necklace]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[sandals]]. As with the rest of the Summer 2023 set, this outfit was designed by [[Sylvia (huajiuhuajiu)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6495711: Official full body render
* !post #6481695: Summer wear lineup

title: elysia_(summer_2024)_(honkai_impact)
body:
The current swimsuit [[official alternate costume]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Elysia (honkai impact)|]], exclusive to her [[Elysia (Herrscher of Human: Ego) (Honkai Impact)|Herrscher of Human: Ego]] form. 

Released as part of the game's Summer merchandise lineup for 2024 involving the Thirteen Flamechasers, her current swimsuit consists of a [[two-tone shirt|two-tone]] [[purple shirt|purple]]-[[white shirt|white]] [[print shirt]] [[tied shirt|tied to the front]], [[white buruma]], [[white sarong]], [[white socks]], and [[purple footwear|purple]] [[sandals]]. As with the rest of the Summer 2024 set, this outfit was designed by [[Sylvia (huajiuhuajiu)|]].

title: ice_cream_parlor
body: A [[shop]] or [[restaurant]] that primarily sells [[ice cream]] and/or related products such as [[milkshake]]s or [[gelato]]. This is for permanent structures, for mobile or temporary locations such as carts or vans use [[ice cream stand]] instead.

title: underground_dweller_(blue_archive)
body:
One of the NPCs in [[Blue Archive]] and a Former Gematria member, he is currently [spoiler] freed by Francis but Francis was killed afterwards by snapping his neck, and was imprisoned again by Shiroko Terror because of his meddling with Sensei, Hoshino and the rest of the [[foreclosure_task_force_(blue_archive)|Foreclosure Task Force]]. [/spoiler]

Former member of Gematria who he sees the world of Kivotos as if it is a board game or TTRPG.
He seeks for the answer of 6th Koan of Jericho: "Is the truth that does not exist really the truth?". In its process, he used Hoshino as his puppet and almost killed Sensei in the process, turned Hoshino into her "Terror" state because of the guilt and trauma happened to her. He was caught by Sensei as he introduces himself to him and showed the "Adult Card" which he accused as cheating.

[spoiler] After losing in all of his plans and The Fury of Set, [[shiroko_terror_(blue_archive)|Shiroko Terror]] put him at gunpoint, but was spared and sealed forever in his dimension.[/spoiler]

title: mario_(series)
body:
Also known as [b]Super Mario[/b] or [b]Super Mario Bros.[/b], the Mario franchise is a series of highly popular and acclaimed video games by [[Nintendo]], featuring Nintendo's mascot Mario and, in many games, his brother Luigi and his best friend Yoshi.

Gameplay in the series often centers around jumping on and defeating enemies. The games usually feature simple plots; the most common theme is that of Bowser, the primary antagonist, kidnapping Princess Peach, whom Mario saves.

Despite the plots usually being very simple, the Mario role-playing games tend to have deeper plots, often involving enemies other than Bowser (many of which involve Bowser actually teaming up with Mario), with aspirations for world domination. Mario and friends have been featured in 200 games, and the series has sold over 200 million copies total, making it the best-selling video game series of all time.

title: isabel_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the [[Inherit (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Harran (Nikke)|Harran]] and [[Noah (Nikke)|Noah]]. An aerial pursuer with a twisted mind. She will track her target to the ends of the earth, regardless of whether they're friend or foe. It's because of her that Inherit is a force to be reckoned with in the skies. She has an [[yandere|obsession]] with the [[commander (nikke)|commander]] and will do whatever it takes to keep them forever.

Like other members of Inherit, Isabel is named after a Biblical figure: in her case, a Spanish derivative of "Elisheba":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elisheba], the wife of Aaron, the brother of Moses.

She has [[red eyes]], [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]] and [[large breasts]]. She is a [[mecha musume]] with an [[armored leotard]], [[mechanical arms]], [[mechanical legs|legs]] and [[mechanical wings|wings]]. Despite not being shown carrying it, she uses a [[shotgun]].

Illustrator: [[dramz|D.ramz]]

h4.Outfits

* !post #5965652 

* [[Isabel (Honeymoon Party) (Nikke)|Honeymoon Party]]

title: bling
body:
A subset of flashy [[jewelry]] including golden rings, gold chain necklaces, and diamond encrusted ornaments. Often associated with [[gangster]] [[hip hop]] fashion and street clothes.

If there's a ridiculous amount of jewelry, consider adding to pool #2116: Blingin'.

title: gundam_gp-03_stamen
body:
[b]RX-78GP-03S Dendrobium Stamen[/b]

The last of the machines produced under the Gundam Development Project, the Stamen [[mobile suit]] resembled the early [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]] but had a slightly asymmetrical head, thrusters and verniers all over its back and sub-arms stored inside the forearms for ease of use as its real purpose - acting as the core unit for the gigantic armament platform known as the [[dendrobium_schema|Dendrobium Orchis]].

title: gundam_gp-02_physalis
body:
A fictional mecha from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 0083]] OVA from 1991.

[b]RX-78GP02A Gundam "Physalis"[/b]

The second [[mobile suit]] unit of the Gundam Development Program carried out by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. 

The heavy assault unit, [b]Physalis[/b], was designed as a beefy, high-powered fortress buster - and for that purpose, it was armed with a mighty bazooka loaded with a forbidden weapon, a [[nuclear_weapon|Mk. 82 nuclear warhead]]. 

The unit was stolen and used by Zeon ace [[Anavel Gato]], who succeeded in firing the nuke at Solomon and display to the world that the Federation would dare violate the Antarctic Treaty.

In [[real life]] the Physalis was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]], famous for his previous work in [[Macross]].

title: gundam_gp-01_full_vernian_zephyranthes
body:
[b]RX-78GP01Fb Full Vernian "Zephyranthes"[/b]

A refit to the original spec [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]] designed with space combat in mind after [[Kou Uraki]] heavily damaged the unit attempting to haphazardly send it into combat. With added verniers and thrusters, the Full Vernian (also referred to erroneously as the [i]Full Burnern[/i]) was a high-mobility, all-round top-class MS.

A black-and-white variant of its HGUC model kit was included as a Limited Edition bonus together with [[Linkin Park]]'s "A Thousand Suns" to commemorate "The Catalyst" being used as the opening for the arcade and PS3 game "Mobile Suit Gundam: Extreme Versus".
other_names: ガンダム試作1号機フルバーニアン

title: z'gok_char_custom
body:
A fictional military manned giant robot  from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

[b]MSM-07S Z'Gok Char Custom/Commander Type[/b]

A red colored revamped version of the [[Z'Gok]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] made by the Principality of [[Zeon]] exclusively for ace pilot [[Char Aznable]] use. It is also designated as the [b]Z'Gok Commander Type[/b] and the first known unit was deployed during the Zeon attack on the [[Earth Federation]] base at Jaburo.

title: nightingale_(gundam)
body:
From [[Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children|Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children]], the [[Neo Zeon]] [[nightingale (gundam)|MSN-04II Nightingale]] is the alternate interpretation of the [[Sazabi|MSN-04 Sazabi]] and the personal [[mecha|mobile suit]] of [[Char Aznable]] in the novel. Together with [[Amuro Ray]]'s [[Hi-Nu Gundam|RX-93-ν2 Hi-Nu Gundam]], the Nightingale was one of the most advanced mobile suits of its time in U.C. 0093. Both mobile suits are equipped with the revolutionary [[Psycho Frame]] technology. Its mechanical designer in real life is [[Izubuchi Yutaka]].

In many ways the Nightingale can be considered as the "big brother" of the Sazabi, and although it is a Mobile Suit, its specifications are comparable to that of a Mobile Armor customized for a Newtype. Aside from its bigger size, this psycho frame-equipped MS also featured more weapons, including 10 [[funnels (gundam)|]], a mega [[beam rifle]], a pair of vulcan cannons, a [[beam cannon]], two [[energy sword|beam sabers]] and a [[shield]] which carries a beam tomahawk and several micro missiles. The Nightingale also has a pair of [[extra arms|hidden arms]] mounted behind the front skirt armor, a pair of back-mounted vernier binders to ensure high mobility for the large mobile suit, and five propellant tanks (three on the backpack and two underneath the rear skirt armor) to fuel its large number of thrusters. 

h4.See also

* [[Hi-Nu Gundam]]
* [[Sazabi]]

title: quin_mantha
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] form the [[Gundam]] [[science fiction]] mechaverse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] anime TV series from 1986.

[b]NZ-000 Quin Mantha[/b]

Also called the Queen Mansa. A Newtype use gigantic [[Mobile Suit]], taking on design cues from other similar [[Neo Zeon]] MSs and MAs such as the [[Qubeley]], [[Psyco Gundam]] and [[Zeong]]. It has very powerful beam weapons and was piloted by [[Puru Two]] and [[Glemy Toto]] at one point.

Its design would later be refined into the NZ-666 [[Kshatriya]], piloted by [[Marida Cruz]].

title: emotionless_sex
body:
When one or more characters involved in a sex act show [[bored|boredom]], disinterest, or [[expressionless|no emotion at all]].

Common signs are a deadpan expression, lack of blushing, or the character on the receiving end [[multitasking]] by doing other activities like [[reading]] or [[playing games]] at the same time.

Don't confuse this with [[empty eyes]].

title: punishing:_gray_raven
body:
Chinese 3D action RPG based on the Unity3D engine, a second production of the "Twintails in Battlefield" (“战场双马尾/战双”) franchise by [[Kuro Games]], Guangzhou.

Punishing: Gray Raven (PGR) is set in a post-apocalyptic world ravaged by the Punishing Virus, a biomechanical virus that corrupts all forms of mechanical constructs and robotics. The player is the Commandant of an elite task force of cyborg Constructs known as Gray Raven, in service to the space station Babylonia, the main resistance front against the Punishing Virus.

PGR has had two previous collaborations with other games/IPs, the collaboration event 'Untold Naraka' with [[NieR:Automata]] during January 2021 (CN) and July 2022 (Global), and the event 'Blazing Simulacrum' with [[Black Rock Shooter]] during August 2023 (CN), though the BRS collaboration is yet to be released on to the global server.

title: nian_(arknights)
body:
[i]Nian, a mysterious visitor from the faraway land of Yan, is willing to provide a little bit of assistance.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

A mysterious woman with profound knowledge of metallurgy. Currently staying in Rhodes Island as a visitor.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[sidelocks]], [[purple eyes]], [[pointy ears]], two [[red horns]], and a [[flame-tipped tail]]  as her main defining physical traits. Her outfit consists of a red [[bandeau]]-style [[tube top]] exposing her [[midriff]], [[white shorts]] held by a [[black belt]] with an ID attached to it, greyish-white [[boots]], and a [[white jacket]] with a distinctive red pattern on the chest side.

She is the first limited 6-star operator, debuting as one of the main characters of the side story [i]Ancient Forge[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Yuuki Aoi]] (JP), Catherine Young (CN), Li Cheng (Sichuanese), Akira Lee Watanabe (EN) and Kim Na-yul (KR). Her illistrator is [[Huanxiang Heitu]].

title: blaze_(arknights)
body:
[i]Blaze, Rhodes Island's most fired-up Operator, will spread her enthusiasm like a wildfire.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]]. Real name: [spoiler]Gu Zhuhuang[/spoiler]

Part of Rhodes Island's elite and commanded directly by [[amiya (arknights)|Amiya]]. Uses a chainsaw/pole saw as her weapon of choice. Notorious for her unrestrained destruction.

She first appears in story [i]Chapter 5: Necessary Solution[/i] and is one of the protagonists in [i]Episode 6: Partial Necrosis[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[nakahara mai|Mai Nakahara]] (Japanese), Zhou Tong (Chinese), [[Cristina Valenzuela]] (English), and Kin Yeon-woo (Korean). Her original art designer is [[Yui (Niikyouzou)]], while her [b]Explosive Blue Flame[/b] outfit is drawn by [[mag (mag42)|Mag42]].

title: bena_(arknights)
body:
[i]Little rapscallion Bena, both intelligent and obedient.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

One of the guardians of the mysterious Castle of Dreams. Like [[Iris (arknights)|]], she collects keepsakes from children on Rhodes Island and sends them to the Castle after applying a secret preservation technique. These mementos will be returned when the respective kids become adults.

Her identical life-sized doll is called Annie.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Morinaga Chitose (JP), Wang Xiaotong (CN) and Kim Hyun-ji (KR). Her illustrator is [[Xiayehongming]].

title: kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!
body:
[b]Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo![/b] (English: [i] KonoSuba: God's Blessing on this Wonderful World![/i] or [i]KonoSuba[/i] for short) is a 17 volume comedy light novel series written by Akatsuki Natsume (暁なつめ) and illustrated by [[Mishima Kurone]] that was published between 2013 to 2020. The series has various spin-off light novels and there are manga adaptations of the main series and spin-offs.

A TV anime adaptation was produced by [[Studio Deen]] and aired in 2016 with a second season airing in 2017. A film adaptation of one of the volumes was produced by [[J.C. Staff]] and was released in 2018. A third season produced by Drive (studio) aired in 2024. Several game adaptations have also been released.

The story revolves around [[Satou Kazuma]], a teenage boy who is [[isekai|reincanated]] into the [[MMORPG]]-like world, and his adventures with his seemingly powerful yet comically unreliable party members.

h4. Characters

* [[Satou Kazuma]]
* [[aqua (konosuba)|Aqua]]

* [[darkness (konosuba)|Darkness]]
* [[Komekko]]

title: uraraka_ochaco
body:
One of the main characters from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

A positive, upbeat 15-year-old girl with [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]] with [[sidelocks]]. Her hero costume is a [[bodysuit]] with bulky [[high heel boots]] and a [[helmet]]. She frequently sports the "[[:D]]" face.

Her quirk is being able to remove the gravitational pull of objects as long as she contacts it with all of her five fingertips pads.

She is voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

title: akuma_(d.gray-man)
body: Akuma are the monstrous creatures that exist in the D.Gray-Man series. They are created by the Millennium Earl, the main antagonist of the series, and serve and take orders from him and the Clan Of Noah. They are dangerous monsters who have no other purpose but to attack and kill humans and the more humans they kill the more powerful they become. It's the job of an Exorcist to find, fight and exorcise Akuma.

title: golem_(d.gray-man)
body: A Golem in the D.Gray-Man series is a small, flying creature that is assigned to every Exorcist of the Black Order. Every Exorcist that works in the Black Order has one Golem assigned to them. Golems are usually used for sending messages and making contact with other Exorcists. Timcanpy, the creature that is usually seen with Allen Walker, the main character, is a Golem for instance

title: silvervale
body:
An English-speaking [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Originally an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]], she later became one of the founding members of [[VShojo]], until leaving to return being an indie on April 26, 2023. She is the (non-IRL) significant other to VShojo virtual YouTuber [[Vei (vtuber)|]], having married to each other in [[Final Fantasy XIV]] in February 2021.

Being a [[wolf girl]] she naturally has [[wolf ears]] (although she sometimes wears [[animal ear headphones|wolf ear headphones]]), a [[pink tail|pink]] and [[blue tail|blue]] [[wolf tail]], [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]] and [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[blue eyes]].

title: miyashita_ai
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]] and a second year student at Nijigasaki Academy. Despite her gyaru style and flashy, loud appearance, Ai is a kindhearted, reliable girl who loves making puns.

She is a [[gyaru]] with [[yellow eyes|yellow]] or [[orange eyes|orange]] eyes and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[bangs]]. At school she ties her hair into a [[half updo]] or a [[ponytail]] with a [[hair flower]]. In her free time she lets her her hair down except for a [[side braid]] on the front.

She wears a [[brown cardigan]] with her winter uniform instead of the regular blue blazer, during summer she keeps the cardigan but ties it [[cardigan around waist|around her waist]] instead and wears a [[wrist scrunchie]] and [[bracelet]]s.

She is a member of [[DiverDiva]].

Voiced by [[Murakami Natsumi (voice actor)|]].

title: miyuki_(kancolle)
body: The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Miyuki[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[short hair|short]] dark [[brown hair|brown]] to [[black hair]], and [[brown eyes]]. She wears the default Special-Type white-and-blue [[serafuku]] top and [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt]]. Her [[rigging]] is also the same as her sisters: a funnel as a backpack with 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] [[thigh strap|strapped to her thighs]]. Her single 12.7 cm twin mount Type A [[ship turret]] is wrist-mounted. She has a tomboyish streak, and a personality that switches rapidly between eager and hyper to fatalistic or depressed whenever things go badly. The real-life [i]Miyuki[/i] was sunk after a collision with [[Inazuma (Kancolle)|]] in June 1934. This made her the only ship of her class not to go into [[World War II]] and remains the only Japanese destroyer accidentally sunk by another Japanese destroyer. This is referenced in her sinking line, "Sorry... I'm going ahead.... see you later...". She is frequently shown colliding with Inazuma or as a ghost in fanworks because of this. h4. Appearance * !asset #24688467: Base * !post #6249111: [[Miyuki Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kai Ni]] * !post #5071504: [[Miyuki (Setsubun) (Kancolle)|Setsubun]] * !post #8775415: [[Miyuki Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kai Ni]] [[Miyuki (Setsubun) (Kancolle)|Setsubun]] * !post #5565590: [[Miyuki (Lawson) (Kancolle)|Lawson collab]] h4. title: shizuru_(princess_connect!)
body:
A [[Princess Connect!]] character and a member of the guild [[Labyrinth (princess connect!)|]]. She also appears in Princess Connect! Re:Dive. She considers herself [[yuuki (princess connect!)|Yuuki]]'s older sister. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair between eyes]] & [[sidelocks]], [[large breasts]], and [[blue eyes|blue]]/[[green eyes]]. She wears a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[white dress]] that shows her [[cleavage]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]] with [[arm guards]], [[white thighhighs]], [[white hairband]], and a [[black bow|black]] [[dress bow]].

title: buggy_the_clown
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Captain of a circus-themed pirate ship and [[monkey d. luffy|Luffy's]] rival. Formerly one of the [[Shichibukai]], and later on, [spoiler]one of the Four Emperors.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Buggy originally served as an apprentice for [[Gol D. Roger]]'s pirate crew alongside [[Shanks (one piece)|]].[/spoiler]

Having consumed the Bara Bara no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can split their own body into pieces and control said pieces however they wish.


He is voiced by [[Chiba Shigeru]].

title: double_down
body: The [b]Double Down[/b] or [b]Zinger Double Down[/b] in some countries, is a limited time chicken sandwich from [[KFC]] composed of two fried Chicken Breasts or Zinger Patties between a slice of cheese, sauce and bacon stripes made of either pork, chicken or turkey. Due to how much meat it has, the sandwich is considered unhealthy due to its high fat and calories by nutritionists and health experts.

title: last_defense_academy_school_uniform
body:
The "[[school uniform]]" of the Last Defense Academy from [[The Hundred Line -Last Defense Academy-]]. 

The male uniform is a [[gakuran]] composed of a [[black jacket|black]] [[jacket]] and [[black pants|black]] [[pants]].

The female uniform is a [[black serafuku|black]] [[serafuku]] with a [[black sailor collar|black]] [[sailor collar]], a [[white neckerchief|white]] [[neckerchief]], and a [[white bodysuit|white]] [[bodysuit]] worn [[bodysuit under clothes|under the serafuku]]. The skirt can be either [[miniskirt|short]] or [[long skirt|long]].

In all cases, the sleeves are [[long sleeves|long]], a [[white armband|white]] [[armband]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]] are worn, and a glowing [[hole in chest|hole in the chest]] can be observed.

title: jougasaki_rika
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Passion (Yellow Sun) category. She is 12, with long, [[blonde hair]] and a [[kogal]] fashion sense. Her interests include stickers and beetles. Although she tries to act like an adult, she is very childlike on the inside.

Her sister is [[Jougasaki Mika]]. Since she is the younger sister, Rika was nicknamed Imoutogasaki (妹ヶ崎). Her card's high stats in the game attracted many players to obtain her along with Mika.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the first CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Futaba Anzu]], [[Shibuya Rin]], [[Mimura Kanako]] and [[Takagaki Kaede]]. Her seiyuu is [[Yamamoto Nozomi]] [山本 希望].

She is in the unit "Dekoration" with [[Akagi Miria]] and [[Moroboshi Kirari]], and their unit costumes are [[Pikapikapop (idolmaster)|]] in the anime. 

h4. External links

* "Jougasaki Rika on EN Pixipedia":http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/Rika+Jougasaki
* "Project iM@S Wiki: Jougasaki Rika":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Rika_Jougasaki

title: hoederer_(arknights)
body:
[i]Sarkaz mercenary Hoederer, the man who approaches, cloaked in war.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]April 22nd[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]185 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]21 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A Sarkaz mercenary leader who worked with Rhodes Island's precursor, Babel, alongside [[Ines (arknights)|]] and [[W (arknights)|]].

After the fall of that organization, he joined the Reunion movement under [[Theresis (arknights)|]]' orders, but later returned to Londinium with Ines after uncovering [[Talulah (arknights)|]]'s secret.

He is one of the main characters during the second arc of the main story.

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Hosoya Yoshimasa]] (Japanese), Su Zhihao (Chinese), Jason Spisak (English), and Jang Min-hyuk (Korean). His art designer is [[Shutun]], while his original NPC art was made by [[Ryuuzaki ichi]].

h4. Skins
* [[Hoederer (courtyard of neka) (arknights)|Courtyard of Contemplation]]
other_names: ヘドリー(アークナイツ)

title: croissant_(arknights)
body:
[i]Croissant, special agent of Penguin Logistics, is willing to provide reliable defensive power for Rhodes Island as a Defender Operator.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Minos[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]September 29[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Forte[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]163 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A energetic messenger and operator from [[penguin_logistics_(arknights)|Penguin Logistics.]] She was sent to Rhodes Island along with her teammates as a liaison, where she assists with a variety of operations. She also possesses monstrous strength, able to send lesser enemies flying with her massive foldable [[hammer]].

She has the habit of impulsively buying fighting equipment and then having to recoup her lost money by selling all kind of merch.

Her motif is based on bovines. Her codename is based on the shape of her horns.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kubo Yurika]] (JP), Wen Liu (CN), Risa Mei (EN), and Yang Jung-hwa (KR). Her illustrator is [[Huanxiang Heitu]].

h4. Skins

title: savage_(arknights)
body:
[i]Savage, Guard Operator of Rim Billiton, has always been thinking of doing something for you and Amiya.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [i][[Arknights]][/i].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]RIM Billiton[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]June 30[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Cautus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]160 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]4 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former agent of a mining company's security force from Rim Billiton. She uses her Arts to detonate her hammer and cause wide devastation, hence her codename.

She is a kind, cheerful, reliable and friendly operator. She likes playing football and cooking.

She personally knows [[Amiya (arknights)|]] and the [[Doctor (arknights)|]], even before the latter's amnesia.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Ayumi Jukimura (Japanese, former), Sachie Hirai (Japanese, current), Muyaruilin (Chinese), Stephanie Sheh (English), and Lee Bo-hee (Korean). Her original art designer is [[renatus.z|TOKI]], while her new outfit has designed by [[usu (9619usu)|usu]].

h4. Skins

title: rainbow_six_siege
body:
Team-based first-person shooter in the [[Rainbow Six]] series. Published by [[Ubisoft]] and released in 2015. The playable characters are split into two categories - Attackers and Defenders.

The game had 2 crossovers with [[Arknights]]. In 2021, [[Ash (rainbow six siege)|]], [[Blitz (rainbow six siege)|]], [[Frost (rainbow six siege)|]], and [[Tachanka (rainbow six siege)|]] were added as playable operators. In 2024, [[Ela (rainbow six siege)|]], [[Doc (rainbow six siege)|]], [[Iana (rainbow six siege)|]], and [[Fuze (rainbow six siege)|]] were added as playable operators.

title: four_murasame
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[science fiction]] mechaverse. She appears in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985.

Voiced by: [[Shimazu Saeko]]

[b]Four Murasame[/b] [spoilers]is a Cyber-Newtype test [[pilot]] at the service of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. Her [[mecha]] of choice is the [[Psyco Gundam]]. A tormented and disturbed (but very attractive) young woman with short [[aqua hair]]. Four doesn't know her real name, as "Four" is the name given to her by scientists as she is "test subject number 4" of the Murasame Cyber-Newtype research experiments program. She is mortally wounded by [[Jerid Messa]]'s [[Byalant]] during the battle at the Titans base in [[Mount Kilimanjaro]], dying in [[Kamille Bidan]]'s arms as his Newtype powers enable him to see Four's spirit leave her broken body.[/spoilers]

title: zuo_le_(arknights)
body: [i]Zuo Le, of the Sui Regulator of Great Yan, there to mind your safety even when it's not his job.[/i] A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]]. A Candleholder of Yan, tasked with keeping [[Nian (arknights)|]] and her many siblings in check. He first made an appearance in the Sui saga as an NPC, before being introduced as an operator during the side story [i]Here a People Sows[/i]. His motif is based on the spiny bush viper and the mythological Tengshe. His [[voice actor]]s are Toyonaga Toshiyuki (Japanese), Li Jiaxiang (Chinese and Henanese), Vincent Tong (English) and Kim Da-ol (Korean). His art designer is [[Jiuri Jiuhao]]. h4. title: willis_tower
body: Formerly known as the Sears Tower, the Willis Tower is a 444.3 meter (1,451-foot) tall skyscraper located in the Loop area of [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], the [[United States]]. The skyscraper was built from 1970 to 1974, and held the title of tallest building from 1973 to 1998, when it was surpassed by the [[Petronas Twin Towers]].

title: gil_somyung
body: Protagonist of [[like mother like daughter|Like Mother, Like Daughter]].

title: alcatraz
body: United States Penitentiary, Alcatraz Island or simply Alcatraz (literally meaning the Gannet in Spanish) was an infamous [[prison]] located on Alcatraz Island,  [[San Francisco]] Bay, [[California]], the [[United States]]. Originally built as a military prison, Alcatraz would later serve as a maximum security federal prison from 1933-1963. The former prison would be widely known for the escape attempt in the summer of 1962 before its full closure.

title: jessica_(arknights)
body:
[i]Jessica, Sniper Operator of Blacksteel, will provide effective attack power for the squad with her professional skills.[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]]. Real Name: [Spoiler]Jessica Brynley[/spoiler].

A fully enlisted Operator from [[Blacksteel Worldwide (arknights)|]] (BSW), stationed at Rhodes Island as part of an exchange training program. Very timid and insecure but reliable and trustworthy, as noted by other Operators, especially with equipment testing. Holds her BSW seniors [[Franka (arknights)|]] and [[Liskarm (arknights)|]] in high regard.

Heavily implied to be extremely wealthy, particularly due to her acquiring Laterano firearms which costs a huge fortune, amassing large amounts of ammunition by "cutting down on food expense", and her interaction with [[Snowsant (arknights)|]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Hirohashi Ryou]].

title: bully_maguire_(meme)
body: Bully Maguire is a meme based on scenes of [[Tobey Maguire]] as [[Peter Parker]] after he's combined with the symbiote Venom in Sam Raimi's [[Spider-Man 3]]. In the film, Parker becomes hot-headed and arrogant after combining with Venom, causing him to treat others poorly. This version of Parker has been dubbed Emo Peter Parker by many across the web, with Bully Maguire acting as an alternative to this title. In Bully Maguire videos, scenes featuring Parker in this symbiote-driven state are edited and remixed into new scenarios to make it seem like Maguire is bullying other characters, typically from the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

title: mystery_box

body:
A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Snowshine is a Rhodes Island Operator assigned to Endfield Industries where she serves as a search and rescue (SAR) specialist.

She is an expert in the geography of polar and high-altitude regions and the author of the book Polar Survival Guide. As a rescuer, she never leaves anyone behind.

It consists of a [[black_hat|black]] [[witch hat]] (or [[sun hat]]) with a purple inner brim, black [[detached collar]] with a [[white ascot]], [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[black dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]], [[x hair ornament]]s on her [[sidelocks|locks]], [[grey pantyhose]], and [[purple footwear|purple]]-[[black footwear|black]] [[gradient footwear|gradient]] [[uneven legwear|uneven boots]] ([[ankle boots|ankle-length]] on her left but [[knee boots|knee-length]] on her right). 

Referred to as [b]Madam Herta[/b] in the JP version.

title: omurice
body:
A Western-inspired Japanese dish that features [[rice]] cooked into an [[omelet]], forming a pouch, and usually topped with [[ketchup]]. The ketchup is often poured to spell out words (such as the intended eater's name).

Typically, the rice is "chicken rice" [[fried rice|fried]] in a pan with chicken and ketchup, but the ingredients can vary. Other variations include [i]omusoba[/i] substituting [[yakisoba]] for the rice and [i]omutako[/i] in Okinawa consisting of an omelet over taco rice.

Stories about the origin of omurice vary, but two such stories attribute its origin to Western-style restaurants. The first says it originated around the turn of the 20th century at Renga-tei in Ginza, Tokyo after the restaurant got the idea for it from chakin [[sushi]], which features sushi rice wrapped in a thin omelet. The second says it originated in 1925 at Hokkyokusei in Minami, Osaka when a cook decided to enliven a regular customer's order of an omelet with rice.

title: evil_eye_(dandadan)
body:
The Evil Eye is a yokai who has spent years bound to the Tsuchinoko sacrificial house and is known for cursing humans to commit suicide with his gaze. After possessing [[Enjoji Jin]], the Evil Eye makes it his goal to kill all humans he comes across, however, after becoming friends with [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]], the Evil Eye makes a deal with him to only target him through an exchange of fights.

In [[Dandadan]], the Evil Eye serves as the tertiary antagonist during the Cursed House Arc and the main antagonist in the Evil Eye Arc.

title: spiked_hips
body:
The character has spike-like objects on his hips. They may or may not be part of his body; they may or may not be natural and may even be accessories. They may be on both sides of the hip or just one.

Not to be confused with horns or antlers.

title: xkcd
body: Comic series by [[Randall Munroe]].

title: eye_on_belly
body: The character has an eye on the lower part of his torso, i.e. the belly. It is usually open, although it is not mandatory (however, the features must indicate that there is an eye there, even if it is closed). If it is not possible to distinguish an eye in some way, it is recommended not to use this tag.

title: sant'antonio_da_padova_con_gesu_bambino
body: [i]St. Anthony with Baby Jesus[/i] is a common motif throughout Christian art. Use it when there's a reasonable similarity in the pose with the original paintings or statues. It must always include a larger person hugging a smaller person while carrying them.

title: bishounen
body:
A Japanese term literally meaning [b]beautiful teenage boy[/b]. The equivalent English concept is [b]pretty boy[/b]. The term describes an aesthetic that can be found in disparate areas in Asia: a teenage boy, around 13 to 18 years old, whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation. Bishounen characters are fairly common in manga and anime; a heavy number of male characters show subtle signs of the bishounen style, such as slender eyes or a feminine face. 

Bishounen are usually drawn delicately, with long limbs, silky or flowing hair, and slender eyes with long eyelashes that can sometimes extend beyond the face. It's best to tag images that focus on the character's beauty, so there tends to be a heavier emphasis on solo or duo images here. Group images are fine, so long as the majority of the males exemplify this trait.

As the name suggests, the term is best used when you can still tell that the character is a male. If there are remarkable feminine traits, consider adding [[androgynous]]. For characters where their feminine traits are at the point of making you believe that they're a female, use [[otoko no ko]] instead.

Note that with [[genderswap (ftm)|female-to-male genderswaps]], this tag can apply if they possess the above-mentioned traits.

In English-speaking circles, bishounen is used somewhat more loosely than it is in Japan, effectively used for any male character with pseudo androgynous beauty, regardless of whether they are "shounen" or not (so variants covering those older than 18, ala biseinen, bichuunen, and bidanshi, find themselves incorporated, as well as those younger than 13).

h4. Examples

* !post #3331027
* !post #4151953
* !post #5566960
* !post #5965649

title: dollar_bill
body:
Any denomination of United States paper currency. Do not use this tag for non-US money.

h4. Valid bills

* One (Face on bill: [[George Washington]])
* Two (Face on bill: [[Thomas Jefferson]])
* Five (Face on bill: [[Abraham Lincoln]])
* Ten (Face on bill: [[Alexander Hamilton]])
* Twenty (Face on bill: [[Andrew Jackson]])
* Fifty (Face on bill: Ulysses S. Grant)
* [[Hundred dollar bill|One-hundred]] (Face on bill: [[Benjamin Franklin]])

h4. See also

* [[banknote]]
* [[dollar sign]]
* [[money]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: United States dollar":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_dollar

title: suzuki_masaru
body:
A [[Nijisanji|]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] who debuted in the first wave of Nijisanji SEEDs, and was integrated into the main Nijisanji group in December 2018. Designed by [[Kamiyoshi Rika]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair|white]] [[multicolored hair|hair]] with [[black hair|black streaks]] and [[bangs]] that [[hair between eyes|hang between his eyes]]. His eyes are [[brown eyes|light brown]].

title: halwa_sweet_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]"Halwa" means "candy" in Arabic, thus "Sweet candy". Derived from her dam's name.[/tn]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by Machiavellian and foaled by Halwa Song. She was first famous for having no tail; being born without one, then for being the mother of 3 G1 winners: [[Verxina (racehorse)|]], [[Cheval Grand (racehorse)|]] and [[Vivlos (racehorse)|]].

title: opfor_(call_of_duty)
body:
A paramilitary faction led by [[Khaled al-Asad]]. [b]OpFor[/b] is short for Opposing Forces or Opposition Force. 

In [[Call of Duty 4]], they took power in an unnamed Middle Eastern country in 2011 following an armed coup. The Russian [[Ultranationalists (Call of Duty)|]] supply [[weapon]]s to the OpFor for being their ally. 

In [[Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2|Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 (2009)]], the OpFor appears in [[Afghanistan]]. The fighters are seen wearing [[camouflage]] [[military fatigues]].

title: the_two-thousand_yard_stare
body:
[b]The 2000 Yard Stare[/b] is a painting by [[World War II]] war correspondent "Thomas Calloway Lea III":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_C._Lea_III] who had traveled extensively in the Pacific theater. 

The painting depicts a nameless [[united states marine corps|U.S. Marine]] at the [[Battle of Peleliu]] with the eponymous stare. The marine is seen wearing [[military fatigues]] with his [[open jacket|jacket open]] and a [[torn clothes|tear]] [[torn jacket|on the left shoulder]], his [[combat helmet|helmet]] [[dent]]ed and [[tilted headwear|askew]]. In the background is a war-torn landscape, other marines, a [[tank]] and three [[airplane|planes]].

The phrase "[[thousand yard stare]]" was popularized after the painting was published in [i]Life[/i] magazine, though it was not referred to with that title in the 1945 article.

* !asset #13755782: Original painting

h4. See also

* [[sanpaku]]
* [[thousand yard stare]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Thousand-yard stare":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thousand-yard_stare

title: combat_shirt
body:
A modern form of flexible [[shirt]] worn by [[military]] or [[military operator|special forces]] personnel on combat. It is a [[zipper|halfzip]] [[collared shirt]] which generally has [[camouflage]] on the sleeves and the shoulder part (similar to [[raglan sleeves]]), while the torso part is left having flat colour for being commonly obscured by [[body armor]] or loadout. 
h1. Examples
* !post #2213951
* !post #3183713

h1. See also
* [[military fatigues]] [tn](When the [[shirt]] also come with matching pants.)[/tn]
* [[tactical clothes]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: spetsnaz
body:
On Danbooru and [[real life]], the term [b]Spetsnaz[/b] generally refers to [[Soviet]] or [[Russia]]n [[military operator|special forces]]. Historically, the term referred to special operations units under the control of the GRU, the main [[military]] intelligence service. Russian special forces wear different [[beret]]s depending on the branch of the armed forces to which they belong.

Spetsnaz operatives are usually depicted wearing the [[gorka|Gorka suit]] or [[military fatigues]] with [[EMR camouflage]], [[balaclava]], [[SMERSH]] [[load bearing equipment]], and sometimes the distinct [[Altyn helmet]].

h1. See also
* [[Russian Ground Forces]]
* [[Soviet Air Force]]
** [[VDV]]
* [[Soviet Army]]
* [[Soviet Navy]]

title: amy_rose
body:
A recurring character in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. She is an anthropomorphic pink [[hedgehog]].

She made her first debut in the [[Sonic the hedgehog (Manga)|Sonic the Hedgehog Manga]], written by Terada Kenji and illustrated by Norimato Sango, and later made her canon debut in the 1993 release of [[Sonic CD]] for the Sega Mega-CD, redesigned by Hoshino Kazuyuki. [[Uekawa Yuji]] redesigned her once more for the modern games.

h4. See also

* [[Rusty Rose]]
* [[Rosy the Rascal]]
* [[Super Amy Rose]]
* [[Toy Hammer]]

h4. External Links

title: public_nudity
body:
Being mostly or [[completely nude]] in a public location, or in a situation where one might be seen by members of the public. This is in contrast to nudity in private areas with no risk of being seen by the public.

Note that [[outdoors]] areas such as beaches and forests can be private. Use only if it is obviously a public location.

h4. See also

title: de_lisle_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[De Lisle carbine]] [[sniper rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A willful T-Doll who likes collecting in-ear headphones. She would try out new products at stereo stores and post detailed reviews on different models on the forum. She is therefore hailed as the headphone guru on the forum, but she has no patience when it comes to giving people headphone recommendations. Since her hobby can be quite expensive, she is always complaining about her bonus being too small.

Voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]] and illustrated by [[Unagi (nakaelric)]].

h4. Appearance

title: third-party_source
body:
A post sourced from any site other than the original artist or (official) source provider. This includes instances of [[official art]] and [[game CG]] that are reuploaded elsewhere online.

Typically, this is a post sourced to another imageboard, booru, or wiki, rather than to the original artist.

This tag can also be applied if a post is sourced from an account who steals and reposts drawings from other artists, whether intentional or unintentional. Heed caution when uploading posts from potential art thieves.

h4. See also

* [[non-web source]]
* [[second-party source]]

title: svch_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Chukavin SVCh]] [[sniper rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She is usually calm and collected, which makes her look unfathomable, but she does show her cute side from time to time. Deep down, she is fiercely competitive and self-confident, and is always working towards becoming an irreplaceable weapon. She will brush off anything if she knows that she is being watched, except when she is offered honeyed dumplings.

Voiced by [[Tamura Mutsumi]] and illustrated by [[Nagu]].

title: upturned_eyes
body:
When a character's eyes are pointed upwards relative to their face. This is often done to look cute, coy, childish, timid, submissive, or pleading.

This expression is sometimes accompanied by the [[head down|head tilted downward]], sometimes with face facing forward but [[looking up]], often occurs alongside [[raised eyebrows]]. It also occurs when a character is [[looking at viewer|looking at the viewer]], but is below their eye-level (such as often the case with [[fellatio]]).

This is different from [[rolling eyes]] or eyes rolled back in the head (as in [[ahegao]]) in that in this case something is actively being focused on and looked at. This is similar to [[sanpaku]] in that the white sclera of their eyes might be visible to three of four sides of their irises, but in this tag refers to a soft, gentle expression, whereas [[sanpaku]] refers to a shocked, angry, detatched, or unhinged expression.

h4. Examples

* !post #459094
* !post #1851379
* !post #2999790

h4. See also

* [[looking up]]
* [[downturned eyes]]
* [[sideways glance]]
* [[Tag Group:Eyes tags]]

title: m99_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A character from [[Girls' Frontline]] representing the [[Zijiang M99]], frequently confused with the Barrett M99 due to similarities with their name.

Shortest of all Sniper Rifle wielding users, she has [[short hair|short]], [[black hair]] with a big red ribbon as well as a stuffed rabbit carrying a grenade. She has red eyes.

She wears a sleeveless white shirt with a red necktie, a red skirt with star pattern that references the Chinese national flag. The triple-bar shoulder badge refers to the battalion leader of Young Pioneers of China in Chinese elementary school. She wears [[bike shorts]] underneath as well as carrying a rabbit-like backpack.

Due to her appearance as a child, she is good at learning new things as well as a role model of good manners, however she's also very aggressive and sometimes she's stubborn due to her less social experience, plus she is extremely cautious about her pride and appearance, which would often lead her to funny and annoying situations.

title: united_states
body:
An image referencing the United States of America, most commonly showing the [[American flag]], depicting [[real world location]]s or [[politician]]s, or making jokes about American culture or American [[patriotism]].

The United States of America (commonly known as the United States, US, USA, or America), is a country primarily located in North America. It shares land borders with [[Canada]] to its north and with [[Mexico]] to its south and has maritime borders with the [[Bahamas]], [[Cuba]], [[Russia]], and other nations. Its national language is [[english_text|English]], though there is no legally official language except in some individual US states.

Do not apply this tag if the character is simply wearing [[American flag print]] clothing, unless the post explicitly references American culture in general.

h4. Examples

title: tf-q_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing [[The Fix by Q]] [[sniper rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A cheerful and vivacious Doll who is also a little clumsy and absentminded. She enjoys doing all kinds of sports in her free time and has a great deal of admiration for Dolls who are good at sports. Her motion and balance modules seem to have some compatibility issue, which hinders her ability to control two-wheeled vehicles properly. After causing multiple accidents, she has been completely banned from using two-wheeled vehicles.

title: big_smoke's_order_(meme)
body:
[i]"I’ll have two number 9s, a number 9 large, a number 6 with extra dip, a number 7, two number 45s, one with cheese, and a large soda."[/i]

A [[meme]] originated from a cutscene in the mission "Drive-Thru":[https://gta.fandom.com/wiki/Drive-Thru] from [[Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas]].

The scene involves [[Carl Johnson|CJ]] and his fellow gang members [[Sweet (grand theft auto)|]], [[Ryder (grand theft auto)|]], and [[Big Smoke]] ordering [[fast food]] at the [[drive-thru]] of Cluckin' Bell. After his gang mates placed their order, Smoke then proceeds to make an extremely large order that later became a subject of parody and meme.

h4. External links
* Know Your Meme: "Big Smoke's Order":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/big-smokes-order]

title: iraq_war
body:
The [b]Iraq War[/b] refers to the [[war]] that began in "March 2003":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2003_invasion_of_Iraq when a coalition of countries, primarily led by the [[United States]] and the [[United Kingdom]], launched a military invasion of [[Iraq]]. The main stated reasons for this invasion were to eliminate Iraq's alleged weapons of mass destruction (WMDs), remove [[Saddam Hussein]] from power, and promote democracy and stability in the region.

The Iraq War had its roots in the aftermath of the [[9/11]] terrorist attacks in the United States in 2001. The U.S. government, under the administration of President [[George W. Bush]], argued that Iraq, under [[Saddam Hussein]], posed a threat due to its "WMD programs":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq_and_weapons_of_mass_destruction#2003_Iraq_War and its potential to support terrorist organizations. However, the invasion and subsequent "occupation of Iraq":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_Iraq_(2003%E2%80%932011) faced significant "controversy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criticism_of_the_Iraq_War and "opposition":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rationale_for_the_Iraq_War, both domestically and internationally.

The conflict quickly led to the overthrow of Saddam Hussein's regime, but the search for WMDs proved unsuccessful, and no substantial evidence of active WMD programs was found. The war also resulted in a "protracted insurgency":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraqi_insurgency_(2003%E2%80%932011), "sectarian violence":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sectarian_violence_in_Iraq#Sectarian_violence_following_the_U.S._invasion, and the rise of extremist groups, including "Al-Qaeda in Iraq":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Qaeda_in_Iraq (later known as the "Islamic State or ISIS":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_State).

The Iraq War had a "profound and lasting impact on the region":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq_War#Impacts. It destabilized Iraq, causing "significant loss of life":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Iraq_War and "displacing millions of people":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanitarian_crises_of_the_Iraq_War. The war also strained U.S. relations with some of its allies and led to widespread protests and opposition to the war. It remains a topic of debate and analysis with regard to its justifiability, consequences, and long-term effects on the Middle East and international politics.

h4. See also

* [[Gulf War]] - The conflict against Iraq in 1990 - 1991

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 2003 invasion of Iraq":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2003_invasion_of_Iraq]
* "Wikipedia: Iraq War":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq_War]

title: scarle_yonaguni_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Scarle Yonaguni]].

Her default ILUNA [[school uniform]] costume comprises a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] underneath a [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]] and [[shirt tucked in|tucked]] under a [[black corset]]. The corset also has a [[checkered skirt|checkered]] [[red skirt]] which is also worn over another [[white skirt]]. She wears a pair of [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[black pantyhose]] and a pair of [[red footwear]] [[multicolored footwear|and]] [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]] on her bottom half. 

Scarle's accessories are composed of a pair of [[earrings]], a [[gold necklace]] with a triangle-shaped [[jewelry]] attached to it, a [[gold choker]], several [[bracelet|bracelets]] on her left wrist, a [[red nails|red]] [[nail polish]] on her nails (except the ring nails that are [[white nails|polished white]] instead,) a [[scepter]] that rest on a [[white belt]] over her waist, and another [[black belt]] worn over her corset. From the reference sheet, Scarle also wears a [[black bustier]] underneath her shirt, has the top buttons of her shirt [[partially unbuttoned|unbuttoned]] to expose her [[large breasts|breasts]] and [[cleavage]] and have few moles on her body, two [[mole under eye|under her right eye]] and one on her [[mole on breast|left breast]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5522267: Reference sheet
* !post #6906251: Merchandise
other_names: スカーレ・ヨナグニ(通常)
スカーレ・ヨナグニ(制服)

Her enchantress costume consists of a maroon-colored [[detached collar]] with a [[necklace]], [[sleeveless]] [[floral print|floral pattern]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[red dress]] with a [[two-tone dress|black inner layer]] and a [[side slit]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[red flower]]s on the top part of her dress, fan-shaped [[earrings]], a [[jewelry|golden]] [[belt]], gold [[thigh strap]], floral [[leg tattoo]]s, and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]] with [[gold trim]]. 

For her [[official alternate hairstyle]] is [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair|jet-black]] [[gradient hair]] with [[red hair|red ends]] and a single [[streaked hair|streak]].
