title: sterling_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Sterling SMG]] [[submachine gun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A self-important Doll with a bit of an 8th Grade Syndrome who believes she's the Chosen One and takes great pride in that. No matter how daunting a mission is, she will never admit defeat, especially when STEN is around. A rampaging fighter who does not hold back on the battlefield, she would sometimes do dangerous things like venturing deep behind enemy lines alone, though she is always incredibly lucky and would make it back safe and sound. All in all, she is a great teammate that would rather risk her own life than put her friends in danger. On an unrelated note, for some reason, she does not work well with left-handers at all.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5072181

h4. Skins

body:
An android representing the [[SR-2 Veresk]] [[submachine gun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

There is nothing more enjoyable to her than ripping through the enemy's frontline and wrecking havoc to their forces, even if she suffers damage or destruction in the process.

title: elira_pendora_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Elira Pendora]].

Dressing up for her [[birthday]], she now has a [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[blue hair]] [[multicolored hair|with]] [[white hair|white]] [[colored inner hair|inner hair colored]], a [[black headband|black]] [[headband]] that created [[hair intakes]], four [[hairpin|hairpins]] with two of them in the shape of a [[cloud]] and [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]], and a [[white ribbon|white]] [[ribbon]] that tied to the back of her [[blue wings|blue]] [[head wings]]. She also goes back to [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]] with her [[long bangs|long bang]]. She can also alternatively have [[medium hair|medium-length]] hair.

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[choker]], a [[long sleeves]], [[open collar|open]]-[[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[buttoned cuffs]], and a [[clothing cutout|cutout]] in the [[center opening|middle]] of the [[shirt]], revealing her [[large breasts|breasts]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[framed breasts]] that have a green [[tag]] attached to the left side with "xxx" written on it. A [[string]] is also tied around the [[shirt]] [[collared_shirt|collar]] with a [[padlock|pad]][[lock]] locked onto the [[string]] that also has "xxx" written on it. On her [[jacket on shoulders|shoulder]], she wore a [[grey jacket|grey]] [[jacket]] with [[notched lapels|notched]] [[lapels]] and a [[lapel pin]] that shaped like a cat (or [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]]). On the left arm sleeves of the [[grey jacket|grey]] [[jacket]], she wore a grey [[armband]] that had "3W1W4" written on it (similar to her "sub-Twitter account username":[https://x.com/3W1W4?s=20]). On top of her [[shirt]], she wore a body [[harness]] that looked like a [[chest harness|chest]] [[harness]] (worn [[underbust|underneath her breasts]]) with [[suspenders]]. She also wore [[black gloves|black]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]] with a [[heart cutout|heart]] [[clothing cutout|cutout]] on the back of the [[gloves]] and a [[wristwatch|wrist]][[watch]] on her left wrist. 

For her [[lower body]], she wore [[grey pants|grey]] [[pants]] with a [[belt]] that has a [[belt buckle|belt]] [[buckle]]. On her right leg, she wore a [[thigh strap]] with [[thigh pouch|thigh]] [[pouch]] used for storing her "DBJ" (Dumb Bitch Juice) [[juice box]], while on her left leg, she had a [[charm (object)|]] of [[famelira (elira pendora)|weewa]] with a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[ribbon]] that had "[[famelira (elira pendora)|weewa]]" written on it attached to the [[belt]] with an [[o-ring]]. For her footwear, she wore a [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels|heels]] with a [[white socks|white]] [[socks]]. Her [[wings]] are also [[white wings|white]] now to match the theme.

[[Pikl (elira pendora)|]] also got a new [[official alternate costume|costume]], wearing a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] (also has [[buttoned cuffs]]) with a [[traditional bowtie|traditional]] [[purple bowtie|purple]] [[bowtie]] and a [[white vest|white]] [[vest]] on top of the [[shirt]]. For its eyewear, [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]] wore [[white-framed eyewear|white]], [[rectangular eyewear|rectangular]] [[glasses]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6793700: Profile
* !post #8267282: Merchandise

h4. Related tags
[tn](Due to the nature of the costume and no actual reference sheet, these tags may or may not apply depending on the post)[/tn]

* [[aqua eyes]]
* [[bridgeless bra]] (use either this or [[framed breasts]] depending on the post)
* [[center opening]]
* [[claws]]
* [[extra eyes]] 
* [[glove pull]] (a different pose [[Elira Pendora|Elira]] can toggle on; see post #6793700 for reference)
* [[keyhole]] (when the [[padlock]] [[keyhole]] is visible)
* [[low wings]]
* [[no jacket]] ([[Elira Pendora|Elira]] has a toggle to remove her jacket)
* [[open clothes]]
* [[pant suit]]

h4. External links

* "Costume reveal stream":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzQRF4L9rMo&t=2896s]

title: c-ms_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Swedish "CBJ - Modular System", or [[CBJ-MS]]/C-MS for short,  in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has a [[long hair|long]], [[messy hair|messy]] [[black hair]]. She has [[red eyes]] with [[mole under eye|mole]] under her right eye. Her clothes are a [[jacket]] with many [[belt]] in it, with a long shirt. It is unknown if she is wearing anything underneath said shirt. She wears a single black thighhigh with a knee pad on it. She wears boots.

Official character description states she tends boss people around that includes that player, however she treats her subordinates well which may show she has a soft side.

Later on, she received a number of skins, one that turned her into a [[aged down]] child version of herself, one that gave her a swimsuit and a tan, and a Halloween one which made her into a corpse bride.

title: vigneron_m2_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[vigneron submachine gun|Vigneron M2]] [[submachine gun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[brown hair|brown]] [[long hair]].
Her default skin outfit consists of a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]], [[goggles]], [[black sports bra]], [[grey belt]] with [[belt pouch|pouches]], [[black pants]] and [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

A Doll who loves making mechanical modifications. As a pragmatist who pursues pragmatism in all things, she dislikes impractical designs that only look new and flashy and likes to modify everything she sees. She claims to despise garage kits and thinks that when it comes to things like cars and planes, only the real deal is worth the time. However, since acquiring the actual items is too much trouble, she secretly creates garage kits using metal.

Illustrated by [[Bobo (6630978)|]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #4968116

She wears [[platform footwear]] with a [[white thighhighs|white]] [[single thighhigh]] and a [[thigh strap]]. As well as a [[key]] [[necklace]], a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[ribbon choker]], a [[tiara]] and [[aqua nails|aqua]] [[nail polish]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she cut her [[long hair]] into a [[short hair|short]] [[bob cut]], though her [[hair over one eye|]]bangs still cover her left eye]].

title: ar-57_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[AR-57]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[aqua eyes]], [[ear piercing]] and wears a [[white headwear|white cap]], [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket]], [[black tank top|black]] [[crop top]], [[pink shorts]], and [[single thighhigh]].

She may look unapproachable, but you will find that she is actually easy-going once you get to know her better. She spends most of her spare time studying tactics and modifying her weapon, which often gives others the false impression she is a battle maniac. She is rather perturbed by this misunderstanding.

Voiced by [[Aisaka Yuuka]] and illustrated by [[koh (minagi kou)]].

title: cx4_storm_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Italian-made [[Beretta Cx4|Beretta Cx4 Storm]] [[bullpup]] carbine in the game [[Girls' Frontline]].

Cx4 is a cheerful-looking girl with [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] tied back with [[large bow|large]] [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]], [[parted bangs]], wide [[red eyes]], a single exposed [[fang]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

The upper half of her outfit consists of a [[black choker]], a red bow pinned with a [[blue gemstone|sapphire]] [[brooch]], a [[black jacket|black]] [[shrug (clothing)|shrug]] with white [[wrist cuffs]], a short, [[white shirt|white]], [[buttons|button-up]] [[crop top]] fastened down with a [[belt]], plenty of [[navel|exposed]] [[midriff]], and of course, her namesake [[gun]].

From the waist down, it's made up of a pair of hip [[strap]]s that hold up a white [[pelvic curtain]], two criss-crossing [[belt]]s with an attached [[belt pouch]], a black bikini bottom, [[garter straps]] that attach to [[black thighhighs|black]] sawtooth-trimmed [[thighhighs]], a pair of [[thigh strap]]s, and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[leather boots|leather]] [[knee boots]].

title: metroid_larva
body:
A [[metroid (creature)|]] in it's infancy. This is the most common form ever seen, as they require highly specific environmental conditions to evolve properly.

Larvae are shaped like green jellyfish with four red nuclei inside their dome, and two sets of fangs to grip it's prey with on their underbelly. They float through the air with ease, and can carry and push things roughly their size or slightly larger. By latching onto prey and draining the life force from it, the prey disintegrates into dust if the lifeless husk is disturbed after feeding.

Not to be confused with [[mochtroid]]s, which are failed clones of metroids- visually distinguishable by only one nucleus.

h4. See also
* [[Metroid]] (the game IP named after the creature)

Has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[very_long_hair|very long]], [[purple hair]] with a [[black_hair|black]] [[streaked_hair|streak]] with a [[hair_bun|small bun]] that's tied with [[purple_ribbon|purple]] [[hair_ribbon|ribbon]] and a [[hair stick]]

She's dressed in a white [[lab coat]] with a [[white dress]], has [[white pantyhose]], [[white gloves]], and [[white_footwear|white]] [[high heels]]. All with a [[gold trim]].

title: bubbly_voyage_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it gives [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] the ability to double jump and hover/float for a limited distance.

The outfit includes a [[short_dress|short]], [[layered_dress|layered]] [[blue_dress|blue dress]]. The dress is trimmed with white [[frills]] around the skirt and has a [[back_ribbon|ribbon trailing from the back]]. The dress and ribbon are [[striped_dress|both]] [[striped_ribbon|striped]] and the dress has a [[bubble_print|bubble pattern]]. Beneath the dress is a pair of blue and white [[bloomers]]. The outfit also has [[short_sleeves|short]] [[detached_sleeves|detached]] [[frilled sleeves]], [[ankle socks|short]] [[frilled socks]], [[black_footwear|black]] [[mary janes|mary jane]] [[high heels]], [[frilled wrist cuffs]], a [[frilled choker]] with a dark blue or black [[bow_choker| bow]], a [[white_hat]] with a [[blue bow]], and a small gold [[hair ornament]] shaped like a pair of bunny ears. The hairstyle for the outfit is [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde_hair]] tied up into two low-hanging [[hair rings]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a primarily green color scheme.

title: gillian_seed
body:
A character from the [[Snatcher]] [[cyberpunk]] science fiction [[video game]] from the 80s.

[b]Gillian Seed[/b] is a detective who is assigned to investigate a breed of [[android]]s known as [[Snatcher (robot)|]]s, who are killing humans and taking their place in society.

The character was inspired and based on [[Rick Deckard]] from the movie [[Blade Runner]].

"Alternate pixiv query":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag&word=%E3%82%AE%E3%83%AA%E3%82%A2%E3%83%B3%20%E3%82%B9%E3%83%8A%E3%83%83%E3%83%81%E3%83%A3%E3%83%BC

h4. See also

* [[Jamie Seed]]

title: fuchikoma
body:
The [[robot|AI-controlled]] [[walker (robot)|spider]] [[tank]]s from the original [[Ghost in the Shell]] manga. Because of a trademark claim arising from the Ghost in the Shell Playstation game, Fuchikomas couldn't be used in the [[Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex]] TV series, so they were redesigned and renamed as [[Tachikoma]]s.

Also see [[Logicoma]] (from [[Ghost in the Shell Arise]]) and [[Gertsecomma]] (from [[Koukaku no Pandora]]).

title: logicoma
body: Logicoma (LOGIstics COnveyor MAchines) are AI-controlled walking tanks from [[Ghost in the Shell Arise]]. They are more primitive versions of the [[Tachikoma]] from [[Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex]].

title: jigabachi
body: AI-controlled [[helicopter|helicopters]] from the [[Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex]] series. Usually armed with underwing weapons and a [[gatling gun]] in a large underbelly [[turret]].

body: A [[3D]] animated [[Ghost in the Shell]] anime series and sequel to [[Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex]], released as a [[Netflix]] original series. Character designs by [[Ilya Kuvshinov]].

title: tachikoma
body:
[b]Tachikoma[/b] is a type of advanced [[robot|AI-controlled]] [[walker (robot)|walking]] [[mecha]] [[tank]] from the [[Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex]] anime television series. 

It is heavily armed and armored and quite intelligent and empathic towards its superiors.

h4.See also
* [[Fuchikoma]] (the design from the [[Ghost in the Shell]] manga that the Tachkomas were modified from because of trademark reasons)
* [[Logicoma]] (the predecessor of the Tachikoma, from [[Ghost in the Shell Arise]])
* [[Gertsecomma]] (from [[Koukaku no Pandora]])

title: kyonko
body:
A fan-created, widely popular, [[genderswap (mtf)|female version]] of [[Kyon]]. She is usually depicted as a [[petite]] girl, with a [[medium hair|medium length]] or [[long hair|long]] [[ponytail]], and wearing a slightly [[oversized clothes|oversized]] [[cardigan]] sweater over her [[kita high school uniform|school]] [[school uniform|uniform]].

The original design was a simple [[genderswap]], with her being depicted as a relatively plain-faced, taller girl, with [[short hair]], before reminders of the original Kyon's fondness for ponytails and petite girls turned them into inherent traits of the character.

body:
Nintendo's upcoming video [[game console]], successor to [[Nintendo Switch]].

It was revealed on January 16, 2025, and is set to be released later in 2025. 

Its [[Joy-Con]]s have a protrusion for clipping into the sides of the main body magnetically, rather than sliding onto the sides from the top like the original Switch.

h4. External links

* "Official webpage":[https://www.nintendo.com/successor/]
other_names: ニンテンドースイッチ2

title: senpai_ga_uzai_kouhai_no_hanashi
body:
[b]Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi[/b] (先輩がうざい後輩の話, lit. [i]Story of a Kouhai Annoyed by Her Senpai[/i]) is a slice-of-life office comedy webcomic by [[Shiromanta]].

Initially serialized as webcomic in 2017 (pool #12918), Ichijinsha began publishing the work in print in 2018. Seven Seas Entertainment has licensed the English version and is publishing it under the title "My Senpai is Annoying". It received an anime adaptation in Fall 2021.

h4. Characters

* [[Igarashi Futaba]]
* [[Takeda Harumi]]
* [[Kazama Souta]]
* [[Hijikata (senpai ga uzai)|]]
* [[Ooishi (senpai ga uzai)|]]
* [[Kurobe Natsumi]]
* [[Sakurai Touko]]
* [[Sakurai Yuuto (senpai Ga Uzai)|]]

h4. External links

* "MyAnimeList: Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi":[https://myanimelist.net/manga/113560/Senpai_ga_Uzai_Kouhai_no_Hanashi]
* "My Senpai is Annoying | Seven Seas Entertainment":[https://sevenseasentertainment.com/series/my-senpai-is-annoying/]

title: kurobe_natsumi
body:
Secondary character of [[Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi]], a childhood friend of [[Igarashi Futaba]].

A woman that gives off "sexy vixen" vibes: attractive, cunning, has experience in love relationships, all that being used throughout the series to troll Futaba. Often hits the mark, despite Futaba's reactions.

[i]Appearance:[/i] [[short_hair|Short]] [[black hair]], often wear black clothes. Sometimes gets darker tint of skin tone than "average" character. [[yellow_eyes|Amber eyes]] with noticeably [[slit pupils]], usually wear [[triangle_earrings|triangle/pyramid earrings]] with matching color. Approx. C-cup.

Associated color: Amber

title: igarashi_futaba
body:
Main character of [[Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi]], the "kouhai" of the story.

A girl being short by stature and temper. Works as [[office_lady|a clerk at office]]. While she's easy to set off, Futaba has her cute and kind side which are being covered by her thick "[[tsundere]] hide", especially towards her senior, [[Takeda Harumi]]. Due to her appearance, she's often being confused as a middle-school student or someone's daughter. Skilled at cooking, particularly around home-style meals.


[i]Appearance:[/i] While other characters have normal proportions, she has rather "chibi" vibes - short stature, rounded wide face, shoulder wide head. [[Medium hair|Medium length hair]] tied in [[ponytail]] and chin-long [[sidelocks]]. [[green_hair|Hair]] and [[green_eyes|iris]] colored in sage green shade. Often seen with a [[fang]] and getting out her [[sharp teeth]] when annoyed. Futaba may be a girl of [[petite]] body but her claws are sharp and able to deliver quite a painful beating.

Associated color: sage green
Associated animal: cat

title: sakurai_touko
body:
Main/supporting character of [[Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi]]. A senior in [[takeda harumi|Harumi]] and [[igarashi futaba|Futaba]]'s company.

A coquettish woman who tends to act as a Greek chorus of sorts, stated to be "popular with men" in the workplace and a low-key source of envy for [[Igarashi Futaba]] on occasion. Pleasant and cheerful, she tends to act without thinking and loves to tease her juniors - a trait shared by her companion [[Kazama Souta]]. She does, however, care for and monitor her coworkers, generally picking up on Igarashi's bad moods quickly and displaying concern. Sometimes she is the cause of some funny situations.

She tends to dress in fairly conservative clothing, sticking with a [[shirt]] and [[pants]] combo, perhaps with a [[sweater]] in colder times. She has [[black hair|black]] [[medium hair|shoulder-length hair]] and [[sidelocks]], [[black eyes]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]]. Her [[large breasts]] are occasionally commented on by other characters in-story. Solid D-cup.

Associated color: "Melon orange":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shades_of_orange#Melon

title: takeda_harumi
body:
Main character of [[Senpai ga Uzai Kouhai no Hanashi]], the "Senpai" of the story. 

A big guy with a big mouth and a big heart. A man with an imposing physique - while he is no taller than one head, he is almost double as wide as any average character and possesses physical strength matching his body. He is brutally honest, speaking his thoughts and opinion aloud and in anyone's face. Harumi is a strong extrovert, often seeking a company to hang out, never being shy around people, and has a loud laugh. He takes great care towards his junior, [[Igarashi Futaba]], and has a "tidal lock" sync with her, meaning he has a high chance to encounter her in random places.

While he is very sociable, he is oblivious to current social standards and trends. He often get punched by Futaba for his brutal honesty or saying too much. It's just his head is that thick. 

Associated color: "'Pomp and power'":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shades_of_purple#Pomp_and_Power purple
Associated animal: bear

body:

When possessing [[Sakurai Yuuto (kamen Rider Den-o)|Sakurai Yuto]], he appears as a wise man, wearing longer hair with a green streak.

body:
An [[alternate form]] of [[kusuriuri_(mononoke)|Kusuriuri]] in [[Ayakashi: Japanese Classic Horror|Ayakashi]] and [[Mononoke]], which he takes on when unsheathing the [[sword of exorcism]]. In this state he has [[dark skin]] with golden [[bodypaint]]/[[facepaint]] and [[black sclera]] eyes.

In the marketing for [[Gekijouban Mononoke]], the official name of this transformation was revealed to be "Shingi". Before that it was most commonly referred to with the unofficial name "Hyper".

body:

Alongside appearing in fanart for Dolls which have appeared in the game, it is popular to depict Dolls that have yet to appear from elsewhere in the series having their Awakenings.

title: katagiri_sanae
body:
A 28 year old [[policewoman]] [[idol]] from [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]]. She has [[large breasts]] and [[brown hair]] usually in [[short twintails|short]], [[low twintails]]. 

Sanae is a former police officer who quit the force to become an idol, largely because the Producer convinced her. She is very flirtatious to the Producer and uses a lot of police terminology when talking. She wishes to be seen by other idols as an older sister and be called Onee-sama, despite the fact that she is shorter than idols who are half her age. Sanae has a black belt in Aikido, Judo, and Karate. She also tends to get upset if others mention that she is single, and is very easily susceptible to drinking to drown her sorrows.

She is in the upper tier for bust size, which is further enhanced because she's rather short. Her cards often reference that she wants to put the Producer in handcuffs, lock him up, and do an interrogation as a teasing double entendre.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Sanae is a former police officer. She sees herself as an older sister to her fellow idols and will go to great lengths to help promote this. She leads training lessons for [[Aino Nagisa]], [[Akanishi Erika]], [[Yagami Makino]], and [[Ohnishi Yuriko]]. While she finds it extremely difficult, Sanae continues to do so because she wants to be considered reliable. She puts other’s wants before hers, and can sometimes wind up looking like a fool because of it. She is nervous when it comes to [[Aihara Yukino]]’s high class tea and ceramics.

Sanae has a habit of getting drunk, and often drags other idols into it as well. She has found drinking buddies in [[Takagaki Kaede]], [[Hiiragi Shino]], [[Shinohara Rei]], and [[Hyodo Rena]] and made friends with [[Yanagi Kiyora]]. Sanae earned a movie role of an evil mahjong player, and in turn became one of [[Munakata Atsumi]]’s ogling victims. Her sense of style seems to mostly include extremely short dresses that show a lot of cleavage. She is said to be stunning in a bathing suit, although she has put on a child’s swimsuit in order to gain attention.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Tachibana Arisu]], [[Ichinose Shiki]], [[Shiomi Syuko]], and [[Sakurai Momoka]]. She is voiced by [[Waki Azumi]] [和氣 あず未].

title: steven_he
body: Steven He O'Byrne (born 31 December 1996), known professionally as [b]Steven He[/b], is a Chinese-Irish actor, comedian and social media personality. Many of his sketches parodies East Asian stereotypes, playing as a fictionalized version of his father who's an overbearing Chinese father with a Tiger Dad personality(ironically Steven's real life father is White Irish) and popularising the phrase "Emotional Damage!".

title: wonder_woman
body:
A [[DC Comics]] superheroine with superpowers very similar to those of [[Superman]] (superstrength, superhuman durability, flight, etc.), but without his weakness to Kryptonite.

Also known as [b]Princess Diana of Themyscira[/b]. She is the Amazonian princess and a daughter of Hyppolita. Her notable weapons including her bracers and her [[Lasso of Truth]]. 

She was created by the late William Moulton Marston and the late Harry G. Peter and was first introduced in [i]All-Star Comics[/i] #8 (1942).

title: zb-26
body:
The [b]ZB-26[/b] or ZB vz. 26 (incorrect nomenclature) is a gas-operated, Czechoslovak [[light machine gun]], chambered for the 7.92x57mm Mauser cartridge. Developed in the 1920s, designed by Václav Holek, and mainly manufactured by Zbrojovka Brno, it saw major use during [[World War II]] by several [[military|militaries]]. The design of the ZB-26 heavily influenced the British [[Bren LMG]], as well as the Japanese [[type 96 light machine gun|Type 96]] and [[type 99 light machine gun|Type 99]] light machine guns. 

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[ZB-26 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links

title: bren_lmg
body:
The Bren is a series of [[light machine gun]]s made by Britain in the 1930s that would be widely used by British and Commonwealth [[military|forces]] during [[World War II]]. Its distinct features are the top-loading [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], carry handle and telescoping [[bipod]]. The design was heavily based on the Czechoslovak [[ZB-26]], hence the name "Bren" was derived from [b]Br[/b]no, the manufacturer of the ZB-26, combined with [b]En[/b]field, the manufacturer in the UK.

After World War II, many Bren guns were re-chambered for the 7.62×51mm NATO [[rifle cartridge|round]] in order to accept [[FN FAL|L1]] magazines.

In anime, the Bren is commonly seen being used by [[Perrine H. Clostermann]] in [[Strike Witches]], as well as [[kazusa (blue_archive)|Kazusa]] in [[Blue Archive]].

h4. See also

* [[Bren (Girls' Frontline)]]

title: boys_anti_tank_rifle
body:
The [b]Boys Anti-tank Rifle[/b] is a British .55 caliber anti-tank [[rifle]], developed shortly before the outbreak of [[World War II]], for the purpose of allowing infantry to fight against enemy armored threats. As with all anti-tank rifles, the Boys was not necessarily meant to destroy the [[tank]] outright, but to inflict a mobility kill by destroying the tank's tracks, or to kill the tank's crew by firing through the armor or vision slits. 

Though the Boys was reasonably effective at the start of the war, the rapid pace of tank development through World War II quickly outstripped the Boys' effectiveness; worse, for anything the Boys [i]could[/i] still damage, so too would the [[Browning M2]], which the British had in ever more plentiful supply and which were useful in several other roles that the Boys was not. By 1943, the Boys was withdrawn from frontline service, replaced by the [[PIAT]].

In anime, the Boys Anti-tank Rifle is famously used by [[Lynette Bishop]] in [[Strike Witches]], as well as [[karin (blue archive)|Karin]] in [[Blue Archive]].

h4. See also

* [[anti-materiel rifle]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Boys anti-tank rifle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boys_anti-tank_rifle
* "Youtube: Boys Anti Tank Rifle":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XOnhPtqj3Jo

title: missing_commentary
body:
A tag that can be temporarily added to posts that have commentary and an active source but cannot be fetched or have not been manually applied, particularly in the case of an extractor being down. This tag is more of a reminder to the uploader to fetch the commentary at a later time and should be kept as close to no posts having this tag as possible.

Not to be confused with [[commentary request]] which is for requesting artist commentary to be translated.

title: browning_m1919
body:
The [b]Browning M1919[/b] is a .30-06 caliber [[weapon]] developed by [[john moses browning|John M. Browning]] as an adaptation of the [[Browning M1917]] to an air-cooled, closed-bolt, [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] medium machine gun. It served as the main general-purpose machine gun of the United States military during [[World War II]] and the [[Korean War]] era. After the Lend-Lense Act was signed, many M1919's were re-chambered in the standard [[rifle cartridge]]s of other alllied nations' militaries. Famously, .303 caliber M1919s served as the main aircraft armament of the [[Supermarine Spitfire]] and [[Hawker Hurricane]] fighters, and other countries with their own industrial bases such as [[FN Herstal]] of [[Belgium]] were allowed to mass-produce their own M1919s under license.

The Browning M1919 is usually seen mounted as the fixed armament or movable turret on [[military vehicle|military]] [[aircraft]]s and [[ground vehicle]]s. In the infantry role, the early-war M1919A4 was used as a medium machine gun with a [[tripod]], though later in the war saw the development of the M1919A6 with a rifle stock and bipod in order to turn the weapon into a true [[light machine gun]]. It could also be picked up and fired from the hip in times of true need or desperation, though artistic depictions of this are usually references to [[Dr. Strangelove]].

In Anime, the weapon is connected most to [[Francesca Lucchini]] of [[Strike Witches]], though it is used by several other characters in the [[World Witches Series]] as well. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M1919A4 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M1919 browning machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1919_Browning_machine_gun

title: globus_cruciger
body:
An "orb topped with a cross":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Globus_cruciger], used for centuries as a symbol of Christ's dominion over the Earth and, by conscious extension, the divine right of kings.  The best-known globus cruciger today is probably the English "Sovereign's Orb":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crown_Jewels_of_the_United_Kingdom#Orbs], one of the signature pieces of the crown jewels of Britain, which was parodied by "Monty Python":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python] as the "Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rabbit_of_Caerbannog#Holy_Hand_Grenade_of_Antioch] in the 1975 comedy film [i]"Monty Python and the Holy Grail":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python_and_the_Holy_Grail][/i].

The [[Kantai Collection]] incarnation of the British battleship HMS [[Warspite (kancolle)|]] carries a black iron globus cruciger as part of her rigging (with the cross in the form of a sword with a radar antenna attached to the pommel), presumably as a reference to the crown jewels (much as her mast is designed to resemble the Sovereign's Sceptre with Cross).

The fashion brand [[Vivienne Westwood]] uses the globus cruciger as its logo and is featured in many of its designs.

h4. See also

** [[fur-trimmed cape]]
** [[red cape]]

* [[shoulder sash]]

title: marie_antoinette_alter_(fate)
body:
[[marie antoinette (fate)|Marie Antoinette's]] [[alter servant|alter form]], first appeared as an NPC in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s crossover event with [[Fate/Requiem]]. This form depicts Marie in the stereotypical "tyrannical queen" personality originated from various French anti-monarchist propaganda as opposed to her actual personality.

The easiest way to tell them apart is that the normal Marie has blue eyes, while this Alter version has [[yellow eyes]], and a noticeably older appearance as her Saint Graph is ascended, with [[large breasts|larger breasts]]; her biography updates her weight from 48 to 53kg due to this. She was officially revealed to be a 5* Avenger, released at the same time as Ordeal Call 2: Id.

title: m1918_bar
body:
The [b]M1918 Browning Automatic Rifle[/b] (BAR) is an American select-fire rifle chambered for .30-06 Springfield cartridge and designed by [[john moses browning|John Browning]] in 1917 for the American Expeditionary Forces in Europe as a replacement for the [[Chauchat]]. Though it is technically [i]not[/i] a [[light machine gun]], the BAR was frequently issued and used in that role, and as such is recognized as one today. The [[weapon]] is recognizable by its straight 20-round magazine, rectangular one-piece forearm, and a [[flip-up sight|flip-up rear sight]] with a windage knob.

This tag also applies to any foreign-produced variants, such as the Polish [b]Browning wz. 28[/b] which notably has a pistol grip (post #6539181) or the French [b]MAS mle 1922[/b].
In anime the BAR is best known for its usage by [[Charlotte E. Yeager]] from [[Strike Witches]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M1918 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

title: osakabehime_(fate)
body:
An Assassin-class servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Osakabe-Hime is a youkai that haunts the walls of Himeji Castle, and a friend of [[Tamamo no Mae (Fate/Extra)|]] and [[Kiyohime (fate)|Kiyohime]]. While she uses a [[bat (animal)|]] motif, Osakabe is actually a kitsune that attained human form (and also notes that it would be confusing if there were two kitsune Servants in the game). She is also a massive [[hikikomori]], and has the ability to control the [[origami]] animals she creates.

Appearance-wise, Osakabe has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] [[gradient hair|fading into]] [[brown hair|brown]] tips that she wears in [[twintails]], [[purple eyes]], and wears [[glasses]]. Her standard outfit is a kimono-themed [[hoodie]] and a [[purple skirt]]. Due to her dialogue in her swimsuit variants, she is also often depicted with a [[plump]] body.

She has a [[osakabehime (swimsuit archer) (fate)|swimsuit version]] for the summer 2019 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Moriyama Daisuke]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Fukuen Misato]]

title: jeanne_d'arc_alter_(fate)
body:
Umbrella tag for the dark version of Jeanne d'Arc from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Also called [b]Jalter[/b] for short by fans.

Unlike the other [[alter servant]]s, Jeanne Alter is a separate entity of the original Jeanne d'Arc. She was created by [[Gilles de Rais (caster) (fate)|Gilles de Rais]], who was so obsessed with Jeanne that he used a corrupted [[Holy Grail_(fate)|]] to "revive" her. As a result, she is a polar opposite of Jeanne, as she wished to destroy France rather than protect it, as she blamed the very existence of France as a cause of her "original" death.

She is often depicted as being [[tsundere]] in official and fan works, and being somewhat annoyed (though secretly admiring) that the original Jeanne treats her as a sister.

For her original Ruler variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc (Fate)]].

For her Santa variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter Santa Lily (Fate)]].

title: antonio_salieri_(fate)
body:
Avenger-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first seen during the Russia Lostbelt.

A composer who was the target of accusations concerning the death of [[wolfgang amadeus mozart (fate)|Mozart]], although there is no actual evidence of murder. Thus, Salieri is classified as an Innocent Monster. He doesn't call himself 'Salieri', but rather the 'Man in Grey' since this Servant is a personification of the concept of 'Mozart's murderer', a supposedly jealous man who took away God's gift to the world of music.

title: amamiya_kokoro_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Amamiya Kokoro]]. 

To differentiate her [[Amamiya Kokoro (1st costume)|default]] [[school uniform]], this one is referred to as her "serafuku-and-[[hoodie|parka]]" costume. It consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[grey jacket]], [[white serafuku]] top with a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[plaid skirt]], [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]]. She also has an aqua-colored [[backpack]] with a [[bag charm]].

Her costume has differing color schemes on the [[sailor collar]] (can be [[pink sailor collar|pink]] or [[brown sailor collar|brown]]), while her jacket can be portrayed with brown-blue faux sailor collars instead of pink-blue and her skirt can also be colored [[brown skirt|brown]] instead of [[pink skirt|pink]]. The brown version is what is currently recognized officially on her Nijisanji profile.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8204044: Merchandise

title: amamiya_kokoro_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Amamiya Kokoro]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/amamiya_kokoro/status/1393897931095244801]. In contrast to her other costumes that were done by her artist [[Sakura Shiori]], her [[yukata]] costume was done by [[Misumi (macaroni)|]].

In this costume, she wears a [[white kimono|white yukata]] with [[long sleeves]] [[sleeves past fingers|going past her fingers]], [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[sandals]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[medium hair|Medium-length hair]] tied in [[double bun]]s held with [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]s
* [[Long hair]] tied into [[twintails]]

title: qixiong_ruqun
body:
Qixiong ruqun is a style of traditional Chinese clothing [[hanfu]], consisting of a long-sleeved blouse or jacket and a high-waisted skirt that reaches just below the armpits, covering the chest. It was most popular during the [[Tang Dynasty]] (618–907 CE) and is one of the best-known [[ruqun]] variations.

This style was commonly worn during periods of Han Chinese rule and is categorized as [[hanfu]]. It often featured flowing fabrics, intricate patterns, and vibrant colors, reflecting the aesthetic preferences of the Tang era.

Not to be confused with other forms of [[ruqun]].

h4. See also
* [[Ruqun]]
* [[Jiaoling ruqun]]
* [[Duijin ruqun]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Qixiong ruqun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qixiong_ruqun
* "Types Hanfu Making":https://www.newhanfu.com/18492.html

title: hanbok
body:
Traditional Korean clothing. It is often characterized by vibrant colors and simple lines without pockets. It consists of a bolero-like jacket called a [[jeogori (clothes)|]] and either roomy [[pants]] bound at the ankles ([[baji]]) for men, or a [[long skirt]] ([[chima_(clothes)|]]) for women. A hat called a [[gat (hat)|gat]] is also common.

Hanbok has a long history dating back to the Three Kingdoms period (c. 1st century BCE – 7th century CE) and has independently evolved over centuries.

title: mato_seihei_no_slave
body:
Also known as [b]Chained Soldier[/b], a manga published in [i]Shounen Jump![/i] in 2019 written by [[Tashiro Tetsuya]], with an anime adaptation developed by Seven Arcs airing in Winter 2024. The series focuses on the story of [[Wakura Yuuki]], a young man who is magically bound to be the slave of a magical soldier named [[Uzen Kyouka]] and is shared between her and her compatriots amidst their fight against "Yomotsu Shuuki", demonic entities from another dimension called "Mato".

title: tsurumaki_kokoro

Her birthday is August 8th. Her seiyuu is [[Itou Miku]].

title: the_grand_tour
body:
The spiritual successor to the [[BBC (broadcaster)|BBC]]'s popular motoring show [[Top Gear]], created by [[Amazon (company)|]] after [[Jeremy Clarkson]] was fired from the BBC for punching a producer. The structure is more or less the same as Top Gear, featuring car reviews, road trips, creation challenges, talk show segments, and celebrity guests (before season 3), albeit with a higher budget than Top Gear. The show features the same trio of hosts, referred to as the "holy trinity" by some.

However, after season 3, the show switched its format, and started doing specials only, up until season 6; with the final special, "[i]One for the Road[/i]", marking the end of the 22 year-long partnership of the original presenters.

h4.See also
* [[Top Gear]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article: The Grand Tour":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Grand_Tour]

title: high_ponytail
body:
A [[ponytail]] that is tied high up at the back of the head.  Contrast with [[low ponytail]].

For [[side ponytail]]s, use [[high side ponytail]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #2603996
* !post #3444084
* !post #97465

h4. Notable characters

* [[Ibuki (Street Fighter)|]] ([[Street Fighter]])
* [[Shiranui Mai]] ([[The King of Fighters]])
* [[Hilda (pokemon)|]] ([[Pokemon]])
* [[Lyn (Fire Emblem)]] ([[Fire Emblem]])

h4. See also

* [[motoyui]]
* [[high side ponytail]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: low_ponytail
body:
A [[ponytail]] that is tied lower on the person's head, typically near the nape of the neck. Contrast with [[high ponytail]].

For [[side ponytail]]s, use [[low side ponytail]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #4457837

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: short_ponytail
body:
A [[ponytail]] that is atypically short, often stopping above the wearer's neckline.

For [[side ponytail]]s, use [[short sidetail]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #3988929

title: nudist_beach_uniform
body:
A "uniform" worn by the Nudist Beach faction in [[Kill la Kill]].

As they oppose the Kiryuuin Conglomerate and their globally monopolized clothing company REVOCS, NB operatives wear an [[naked belt|impractical ensemble of utility belts]], sleeves, [[thighhighs]] and holsters that [[convenient censoring|somehow manage to cover their privates]] - [[revealing clothes|and little else]].

h4.See also

* [[List of Uniforms]]
other_names: ヌーディストビーチ(キルラキル)

title: anastasia_hoshin
body:
A character from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]]. She is the head of the Hoshin Trading Company and a candidate to become the 42nd King of Lugnica.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[swept bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[star hair ornament]], [[white headwear|white]] [[papakha]] [[fur hat]] with [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s, a [[white dress|white]] [[ layered dress]] with [[fur-trimmed sleeves]], a [[white cape|white]] [[fur cape]], a [[necklace]], and [[white footwear]].

She is voiced by [[Ueda Kana]].

h4. External links

* "Re:Zero Wikia: Anastasia Hoshin":https://rezero.fandom.com/wiki/Anastasia_Hoshin
other_names: アナスタシア・ホーシン
アナスタシアホーシン

title: grapes
body:
A small, round, smooth-skinned edible [[fruit]], usually purple, red, or green.

h4. Example
* !post #7699615: purple
* !post #6734907: purple and green


h4. See also

* [[currant]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: money_gun
body:
A [[gun]]-shaped novelty device designed to shoot out paper money.  Also called a [i]cash cannon[/i].  A common version of the device is a boxy gun-shaped device where a stack of bills are loaded into the top and its lid helps to hold down the stack of bills.  With the pull of the trigger a wheel inside touching the lowest bill in the stack will rapidly spin and propel the bill through the slot in the front.  It can readily be used to make [[falling money]].

Money guns appear as a weapon used in Osaka in the series [[Kill la Kill]].

title: throwing_money
body: The act of [[throwing]] monetary items (e.g. [[coin|coins]], [[banknote|banknotes]]) at an intended direction. Usually tagged when a character is throwing banknotes in the air to simulate [[falling money]].

title: unusual_rain
body:
For rain that isn't made of [[water]].

h4. See also
* [[Raining blood]]
* [[Falling money]]
* [[Digital rain]]

title: lychee
body:
A type of fruit growing from an evergreen tree native to Southeastern China.  It is a semi-conical red fruit with an inedible rind that must be peeled like an orange, and a white, sweet pulpy center. 

h4.See Also:

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: vegetable
body:
Edible seeds or roots or stems or leaves or bulbs or tubers or nonsweet fruits of any of numerous herbaceous plant. A [[carrot]] for example.

Tag can cover all types of vegetables when there is an abundance of individual vegetables in the image.

h4. See

* [[Food]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: dragon_fruit
body:
Also called a [i]pitaya[/i], it is the fruit of several [[cactus]] species indigenous to the Americas. It has a fiery-looking rind, while the fruit inside can be white, pink or beet red, and has lots of small edible seeds.

h4. Example
* !post #7049302 

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: white_strawberry
body:
Variant of [[strawberry]] which has white colour. Its taste is said to be sweeter than the more-common red counterpart, almost candy-like, and taste similar to pineapple.

Could also be a depiction of an unripe strawberry.

title: banana_boat
body:
An inflatable swimming boat shaped like a banana. Don't tag them [[banana]] unless there is an actual banana in the image as well.

h4.See also

* [[inflatable raft]]
* [[inflatable toy]]
** [[inflatable dolphin]]

title: carbonara_(food)
body:
A pasta dish made with [[egg]]s, hard [[cheese]], fatty cured pork, and black pepper.

h4.See also

* [[Noodles]]
* [[Spaghetti]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: pearl_jam_(stand)
body:
[[Tonio Trussardi]]'s [[stand (jojo)|Stand]]. It takes the form of a swarm of small creatures that look like they're made of various vegetables.
Namesake is the American rock band Pearl Jam. Renamed to Opal Jam in [[jojo no kimyou na bouken: all star battle|All Star Battle]] and to Pole Jam in the anime translations.

title: tonio_trussardi
body:
Side character in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]'s 4th part, [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]].

He is an Italian chef who cooks dishes that heal a person's aliments in a violent manner.

His Stand is [[Pearl Jam (Stand)]].
other_names: トニオ・トラサルディー

title: stray_cat_(jojo)
body:
A [[cat]] and [[Stand (jojo)|]] User from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Its Stand ability awoke after it died in an accident, reviving the buried cat as a plant. The plant acts much like the cat did in its previous life, with eyes and feline mannerisms.

Its Stand power is named "Stray Cat", granting it a dangerous control over air. [[Kira Yoshikage]] befriends the cat and names it Nekogusa, literally "catgrass".

title: sheer_heart_attack
body:
An attack used by [[Kira Yoshikage]]'s [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Killer Queen]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]].  It is a heat seeking, mobile bomb that will relentlessly pursue its target, destroying anything that gets in its way. It can operate far away from Kira and is nigh-indestructible.

Namesake is the [[queen (band)|Queen]] album [i]Sheer Heart Attack[/i].

h4. Example
* !post #4900301
other_names: シアーハートアタック

title: dormammu
body: Villain from [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] and [[Doctor Strange]]'s archenemesis. A god of magic who rules over the Dark Dimension.

title: kawajiri_kosaku
body: Character from Part 4 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], Diamond is Unbreakable.  Victim of identity theft by [[Kira Yoshikage]] and the persona Kira subsequently adopts.

title: vision_(marvel)
body: Character from [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. A robot created by [[Ultron]] to defeat the Avengers, he would later turn against his creator and join the Avengers. He was married to [[Scarlet Witch]] for a while.

title: scarlet_witch
body:
Character from [[marvel|Marvel Comics]], real name Wanda Maximoff. Originally introduced in [[X-Men]] as a villain, she would later become a member of the Avengers.
She's a mutant with the ability to control probability, which later evolved into control over the powerful Chaos Magic.
other_names: スカーレット・ウィッチ
スカーレットウィッチ

title: nude_beach
body:
A [[beach]] where [[nude|nudity]] is permitted or encouraged.

Not all images featuring nudity at the beach is set at a nude beach. Other evidence such as signs permitting nudity, naked bystanders, or the character's casual reaction to their nakedness is evidence of the image being set on a nude beach.

h4. See also

* [[nudist]]
* [[exhibitionism]]
* [[public nudity]]

title: mikami_ryou_(kamen_rider_blade)
body:
A (somewhat comic relief) character from Episode 29~30 of [[kamen_rider_blade_(series)|Kamen Rider Blade]]. He is a [[takoyaki]] cooker and a look-alike of [[Aikawa Hajime]]. 

h4.See also

* "Kamen Rider Wikia":http://kamenrider.wikia.com/wiki/Ryo_Mikami
other_names: 鯛焼き名人アルティメットフォーム

title: anman
body: A [[steamed bun]] with sesame oil and a red bean paste filling.

title: streaking
body:
An [[exhibitionism]] act of [[running]] around [[nude|naked]] in public. The act is often done for shock value, fun, protest, or for sexual intents.

h4.See also

* [[flashing]]
* [[mooning]]

title: wasp_(marvel)
body: Character from [[marvel|Marvel Comics]], real name ([[Janet van Dyne]]). She has the power to shrink to a height of several centimeters, fly via insectoid wings, and fire energy blasts. She is a founding member of [[avengers (series)|the Avengers]] and the one who gave them their name as well as a longtime leader of the team. She is also the ex-wife of [[Hank Pym]] and the stepmother of Nadia van Dyne.

title: vandalism
body:
Deliberate destruction or damage to property.

h4. See also

* [[graffiti]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Vandalism":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vandalism]

title: thor_(marvel)
body:
Character from [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]], based on the mythological god of the same name. The prince of Asgard who was banished to Midgard (Earth) for his arrogance and became a superhero. He originally had the civilian identity of Donald Blake, and only recovered his identity as Thor after proving himself worthy of wielding [[Mjolnir (marvel)|]]. His archenemy is his adoptive brother [[Loki (marvel)|]].
He would later become a founding member of the Avengers.

title: panties
body:
Female [[underwear]] that covers the crotch.

Panties have no leg portions and come with a narrow waistband. For underpants with legs, see [[boyshort panties]] or [[bike shorts]].

h4. Examples

* !post #1663875

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Sexual Attire]]
* [[Tag Group:Panties]]

title: iron_man
body:
[[marvel|Marvel Comics]] superhero, one of the founding members of the Avengers.

Born [[tony stark|Anthony Edward Stark]], and usually called Tony, he is an industrialist playboy and ingenious engineer who suffers a severe heart injury during a kidnapping in which his captors attempt to force him to build a weapon of mass destruction. He instead creates a powered suit of armor to save his life and escape captivity. He later uses the suit to protect the world as Iron Man. Through his multinational corporation ― Stark Industries ― Tony has created many military weapons, some of which, along with other technological devices of his making, have been integrated into his suit, helping him fight crime.

title: ant-man
body: [[Marvel]] superhero with the power to shrink or enlarge himself, as well control an army of ants. The original Ant-Man was [[Hank Pym]], who would later be succeeded by [[Scott Lang]].

title: the_falcon_and_the_winter_soldier
body: Disney+ series set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]]. It stars [[Sam Wilson]] / Falcon and [[Bucky Barnes]] / Winter Soldier, and it serves as a sequel to [[Avengers: Endgame]].

title: loki_(disney+)
body: Disney+ series set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) and starring the [[Loki (marvel)|eponymous character]].

title: lind_(neural_cloud)
body:
An Agent in [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]]. A clinical test subject Doll developed by Ultimate Life Holdings, a past instance of [[AA-12 (girls' frontline)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6153714

h4. See also

* "List of Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud characters":[/wiki_pages/list_of_girls'_frontline_characters#dtext-rc]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Lind":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Lind]
other_names: リンド(ニューラルクラウド)

title: runaways
body: A TV series set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] based on the comic of the same name, released on Hulu between 2017 and 2019.
other_names: ランナウェイズ(マーベル)
ランナウェイズ(テレビドラマ)

title: iron_fist_(netflix)
body: American television series based on the [[Marvel]] Comics character Iron Fist. It is set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]].

title: jessica_jones_(series)
body: American television series based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name. It is set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]].

title: daredevil_(netflix)
body: American television series based on the [[Marvel]] Comics character [[Daredevil]]. It is set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU), sharing continuity with the franchise's films, and was the first Marvel [[Netflix]] series leading to the crossover miniseries The Defenders.

title: agents_of_shield
body: American television series based on the [[Marvel]] Comics organization S.H.I.E.L.D. (Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement, and Logistics Division), a peacekeeping and spy agency in a world of superheroes. The series was the first to be set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]].

title: mg36_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K MG36]] [[machine gun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She doesn't speak much, but that's not because she's introverted. She's keenly aware of her own worth and is utterly devoted to her employer. It seems she was once involved in some sort of mysterious work in the past and is very reluctant to talk about her past history. However, she visibly relaxes when it comes to discussing sci-fi movies and fiction.

In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], MG36 appears as [[Rise (neural cloud)|]]. Voiced by [[Yukana]] and illustrated by [[Funengliang jieheti]].

h4. Appearance

title: deadpool_&_wolverine
body:
The 34th film in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) and a sequel to [[Deadpool (movie)|Deadpool (2016)]] and [[Deadpool 2]] (2018), starring [[Deadpool]] and [[Wolverine (x-men)|]].

It integrates Deadpool from Fox's [[X-Men film series]] into the MCU and retains the R rating of the previous films, making it the first MCU film to have such a rating. It also features characters from several Marvel movies that preceded the MCU.
other_names: デッドプール&ウルヴァリン

title: athena_cykes
body:
A new character in [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Dual Destinies]] who is playable in several cases. She is a rookie lawyer at [[Phoenix Wright]]'s agency and thus the junior of [[Apollo Justice]]. [[Juniper Woods]] is a childhood friend of her. Has the ability to discern emotions from the tone of a person's voice.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[orange hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], tied into a [[side ponytail]] and decorated with a [[blue ribbon|bl]][[blue hairband|ue]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] [[hairband]]. She also has [[blue eyes]].

She wears a [[single earring|single]] [[crescent earrings|crescent]] [[earrings|earring]], a [[necklace]] - Widget; an [[open jacket|open]] [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[jacket]] with [[lapels]] and [[three-quarter sleeves]] that end in [[sleeve cuffs|cuffs]], a [[lapel pin]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[untucked shirt|untucked]] [[shirt]] with an [[open collar]], a [[blue necktie|blue]] [[necktie]], a [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] [[gloves|glove]], a [[yellow skirt|yellow]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt|mini]][[skirt]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[pantyhose]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]].

[spoiler]Her mother was [[Metis Cykes]], who was murdered by a spy known as "The Phantom." [[Simon Blackquill]] was convicted of the murder instead, and Athena became a lawyer in order to overturn his sentence.[/spoiler]

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Kizuki Kokone

title: tina_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Tina[/b], known as [b]Rika[/b] (リッカ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [[Pokemon Masters EX]]. Formerly listed as Camilla and Sazanka (サザンカ) in the very first datamines of the game.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. She wears a [[black hairband|hairband]], a [[black sports bra|sports bra]] under an [[partially unzipped|unzipped]] [[orange jacket|orange]] [[two-tone jacket|and]] [[white jacket|white]] [[track jacket|jacket]] with [[three-quarter sleeves|3/4-length sleeves]], a [[red wristband|band]], [[bike shorts|spats]], a [[bandaid on knee|bandaid]], [[orange footwear|orange]] [[sneakers|shoes]], and a [[white bag|white]] [[shoulder bag|bag]].

She is close friends with [[paulo_(pokemon)|Paulo]], and her partner Pokémon is [[Flareon]].

Voiced by [[Takagaki Ayahi]].

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Tina":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Tina]

title: mary_(identity_v)
body:
Mary, also known as [b]Bloody Queen[/b], is a playable Hunter in [[Identity V]]. Formerly the Queen of France who led a life of luxury and was innocently ignorant of the common folk’s suffering, she was then executed via beheading and became a Hunter through mysterious means. Her main ability is summoning a mirror image of herself that follows her exact movements and attacks, albeit mirrored.
She is closely based off "Marie Antoinette":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marie_Antoinette, the last queen of France before the French Revolution, with elements of the folklore "Bloody Mary":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloody_Mary_(folklore).

Mary has [[pale skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[hair between eyes]] and [[hair rings]], and [[hollow eyes]]. Her head is [[stitched neck|stitched to her neck]].
She wears a [[red dress|red]] [[gown]] with [[three-quarter sleeves]] and [[back bow]], and a [[brown belt]]. Her weapon is a [[glass shards|glass shard]].

h4. Cosmetics 
* [[mary (amethyst duchess) (identity v)|Amethyst Duchess]]
* [[mary (bloodbath) (identity v)|Bloodbath]]
* [[mary (lady bella) (identity v)|Lady Bella]]
* [[mary (last dance) (identity v)|Last Dance]]
* [[mary (night tides) (identity v)|Night Tides]]

h4. External links

title: hoshimachi_suisei_(1st_costume)
body:
The current default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Hoshimachi Suisei]], designed by [[Teshima Nari]].

On her head she has a [[grey hat|grey]] [[plaid hat|plaid]] [[beret]] adorned with a [[crown]],  a [[blue choker|blue]] [[star choker]], a pair of [[star earrings]], and a [[blue ascot]].

She wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[skirt set]] comprising a [[double-breasted]] [[grey jacket|grey]] [[plaid jacket]] with [[three-quarter sleeves|three-quarter-length sleeves]] and white [[sleeve cuffs]], a two-part [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[frilled skirt|black-frilled]] [[grey skirt|grey]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]] with a left-cutout for a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[frilled skirt|black-frilled]] [[layered skirt]] which she wears with [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] underneath, and a [[blue belt]] adorned with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[waist bow]].

She furthermore has a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], a [[bead bracelet|beaded]] [[star bracelet]], and on her legs a pair of [[uneven legwear|uneven socks]] comprising a [[blue socks|blue]] [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]] and a [[black thighhighs|black]] [[single thighhigh|thighhigh]], a black [[thigh strap]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]]  [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[ankle boots]].

For her original design from her indie days and early Inonaka Music days, see [[Hoshimachi Suisei (old design)]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3931913: Profile
* !post #3705812: Reference sheet

title: satou_mei
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Nekomugiharu]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]]/[[black hair]] with [[swept bangs|swept]] [[bangs]]. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[tented shirt|tented]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[sleeves rolled up]] [[three-quarter sleeves|past her elbows]], [[blue bow|blue]] [[bow]][[bowtie|tie]] or [[blue necktie|blue]] [[necktie]], and a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]]. Usually holds her [[school bag]].

title: nanashi_mumei_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive English]]'s [[Nanashi Mumei]].

It consists of a [[brown capelet|brown]] [[hooded capelet]] secured by a [[brown bowtie]] and a longer [[two-sided cape]] that splits like feathers, a [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[three-quarter sleeves|forearm length sleeves]], an [[underbust]] [[brown corset]], [[archery shooting glove]]s, a [[belt]] with a [[lantern]], a [[belt pouch|pouch]], and a small [[sheathed]] [[dagger]] hanging from it, a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[single thighhigh|a thighhigh sock]] on her left leg, [[single kneehigh|a kneehigh sock]] on her right leg, and brown [[ankle boots]].

Her main hairstyle here is [[very long hair|long hair]] in a [[ponytail]], held in place with a [[feather hair ornament|feather hair tie]]. Her bangs are secured by a rune-shaped [[hairclip]].

title: sleeves_rolled_up
body:
When a character wears their clothes with both or one of its sleeves rolled up. This can be either to cool themselves off, to prevent the sleeves from getting dirty or wet, because of clothing regulations (for example [[uniform|uniforms]]), or because of their taste in fashion.

Includes sleeves visibly only folded up once. Not to be confused with [[sleeves pushed up]], in which case the sleeves are only pushed up the arm, instead of being folded up.

h4. See also
* [[three-quarter sleeves]]
* [[tasuki]]

For [[pants]], see [[pants_rolled_up]].

title: living_doll_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by [[Shadows house]] Living Dolls. 

The female version consists of a [[black dress|dark]] [[blue dress]] with [[puffy sleeves]] [[three-quarter sleeves|coming up to the elbows]], a pair of [[blue socks|dark-blue socks]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]]. It's also attached with a [[white apron|white]] [[lace-trimmed apron]] when they're cleaning or doing chores and white lace ruffles collar when they do "face" duty. 

The male version consists of a [[white shirt|white button-up shirt]], [[blue pants|dark blue pants]], and it is also attached with a [[wing collar]], a [[green vest]], and a [[black bowtie]] when they’re cleaning or doing chores. When they are on "face" duty, they wears a [[blue shirt|dark blue shirt]] attached with a white lace ruffles collar over the standard outfit.

title: hinoshita_kaho_(winter_casual)
body:
The [[casual]] winter [[official alternate costume|outfit]] worn by [[Hinoshita Kaho]] in [[Link! Like! Love Live!]].

The innerwear consists of a [[red sweater|reddish]]-[[pink sweater|pink]] [[turtleneck sweater]] and a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]].

The outerwear is composed of a [[white jacket|white]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]] with [[three-quarter sleeves]], giving the effect of [[layered sleeves]], and a [[white hat|white]] [[pom pom beanie]].

Accessories include a [[heart necklace]] and [[hair bobbles]] instead of the usual rabbit hair ornaments.

title: hop_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Hop[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon swsh|Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Trainer from the town of Postwick is Leon’s little brother. His experience in the Gym Challenge inspired him to chase a new dream of becoming a Pokémon Professor [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His first Pokémon was [[Wooloo]].

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[white pupils]], and [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]]. He wears a [[black shirt]] under an [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[fur-trimmed jacket|jacket]] with [[three-quarter sleeves|3/4-length sleeves]], [[black pants]], [[shoes]], and carries a [[green bag|green]] [[duffel bag]].

title: elbow_sleeve
body:
A tightly wrapped sleeve around only the elbow, generally used to provide support for labor that stresses the arms. Typically worn by [[tennis]], [[basketball]], or [[volleyball]] players.

If it extends all the way to the wrist or shoulder, try using tags like [[arm warmers]], [[detached sleeves]], [[bridal gauntlets]] or [[elbow gloves]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[elbow pads]]
* [[three-quarter sleeves]]

title: glacia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Glacia[/b], known as [b]Purim[/b] (プリム) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

One of the Hoenn League Elite Four, this elegant lady traveled far to hone her Pokémon's Ice-type moves. She seeks opponents with a fiery passion for battle [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

She has [[pale skin]], [[blue eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] styled in [[quad tails]]. In her [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] outfit, she wears a [[white choker]], a [[low-cut]] [[purple dress]] with [[three-quarter sleeves|three-quarter-length sleeves]], [[white gloves]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[high heels]].

h4. Official Art
* !post #4401645: RSE
* !post #4401646: ORAS

h4. External links

* "TV Tropes: Characters / Pokémon Ruby and Sapphire":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Characters/PokemonRubyAndSapphire]

title: sleeves_pushed_up
body:
When a character wears his or her clothes with both or one of its sleeves pushed or pulled up. This can be either to cool themselves off, to prevent the sleeves from getting dirty or wet or getting in the way of what they are doing, or simply due to the characters' taste in fashion. They also do this if they are preparing to deliver a blow to someone in a comical way or if they are getting ready for something difficult.

Do not confuse with [[sleeves rolled up]], in which cases the sleeves are carefully folded up the arm, not simply pushed up.

For [[pants]], see [[pants rolled up]].

h4. See also

* [[three-quarter sleeves]]

title: anya_melfissa_(steampunk)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Anya Melfissa]]. It has a [[steampunk]] theme.

It consists of a [[brown cape]] over her right shoulder, a [[green shirt]] with [[cross-laced_sleeves|cross-laced]] [[puffy sleeves|puffy]] [[three-quarter sleeves]], a [[green bowtie]] with a [[white ascot]] attached with a [[green brooch]], a [[chest harness]], an [[underbust]] [[brown corset]], [[brown gloves|brown]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[multiple belts|multiple]] [[leather belt]]s with a [[belt pouch]] and a book carrier, [[brown shorts]] with [[o-ring thigh strap]]s and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[thigh boots]]. She also has an optional [[respirator]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is either [[short hair]] a [[bob cut]] or [[long hair]] tied into a [[low ponytail]] with a [[brown bow|brown]] [[hair bow]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5587041: Profile

title: hanabusa_lisa_(3rd_costume)
body:
The third [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VSPO!]]'s [[Hanabusa Lisa]], as seen in post #5166694.

A non-conventional Chinese-themed outfit.

In this costume, her hair is styled in [[twintails]] with [[double bun]], and the base of the buns is encircled with what appears to be a white [[lace-trimmed hair ornament|lace-trimmed ornaments]] atop her head, tied with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]].

For the torso, she wears a set of clothing in [[chinese clothes|Chinese style]] consisting of what appears to be a [[pink shrug|pink]] Chinese-styled [[shrug (clothing)|shrug]] with a high collar similar to [[mandarin collar|mandarin collars]]. The shrug has [[puffy long sleeves|puffy]] [[three-quarter sleeves|elbow length sleeves]] with [[arm_cutout|arm cutouts]] on both sleeves ornamented with a flower-shaped cloth. Under the shrug, she wears a [[cropped_shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt|white]] [[frilled_shirt|frilled]] shirt with a [[see-through_cleavage|see-through cleavage]]. The [[crop_top|cropped]] top hinted a [[midriff_peek|slight midriff]] and ornamented with a [[black ribbon]] from the neck part until the cropped end of her top and to her right thigh and left hip. She also wears a [[lace_gloves|lace]] [[half_gloves|half gloves]]. [s]Alternatively, if these are too much, you can probably just put [[china dress]] and [[pink dress]] and call it a day.[/s]

Below, she wears a [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] under a [[pink overskirt]] that serves as a [[pelvic curtain]]. She wears [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrically styled]] [[white thighhighs]] in which her right thigh-high is connected with an [[o-ring]] to what appears to be a [[single pantsleg]] under the skirt. For shoes, she wears [[black_footwear|black]] [[flats]] with ankle strap.

h4. External links

* "Costume reveal stream":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yBi-NlPTgaY

title: boku_wa_konya_deteiku
body:
[b]Boku wa Konya Deteiku[/b] is the eleventh single by [[22/7]], as well as the [[costume]] associated with it.

The costume consists of a white-and-grey [[asymmetrical dress|asymmetrical]] [[pleated dress]] with [[three-quarter sleeves]], [[white belt]], [[grey socks|grey]] [[ankle socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. An [[emblem]] of 22/7 is sewn onto the left chest of the dress. Decorative [[buttons]] adorn the center of the dress, which does not have a functional front [[open dress|opening]].

h4. Examples
* !post #6407170: [[Album cover]]

title: ayunda_risu_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd/[[witch]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Ayunda Risu]].

It consists of a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[witch hat]] decorated with a [[hat belt|belt]] and [[hat flower|flowers]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[brown jacket]] with [[breast pocket]]s, [[three-quarter sleeves|sleeves past her elbows]] with noticeable [[sleeve cuffs]] and held together with [[gold chain]] [[aiguillette]]s, worn over a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] with a [[black bowtie]] pinned with a [[red brooch]], [[white gloves]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[medium skirt]] consisting of [[brown skirt|brown]] outer layer and [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt]] underneath, [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] is [[medium hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[sidelocks]] with the same [[leaf hair ornament|leaf-shaped]] [[hairclip]] from her default costume.

title: mobius_(honkai_impact)
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i] character. 

One of the [[Thirteen Flame-Chasers (honkai impact)|]], codenamed [b]Infinity[/b]. She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], [[green eyes]], and a prominent black [[tiara]]. title: nayuta_(chainsaw_man)
body:
A character originally introduced [[Fujimoto Tatsuki]]'s oneshot [i][[Yogen no Nayuta]][/i], she would later be repurposed in [[Chainsaw Man]] as the reincarnation of the Control Devil following [spoiler] [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s death. [/spoiler]

Nayuta takes the appearance of a young girl with black, shoulder-cut hair and with a single large bang that hangs in front of her face, as well as a mole under her left eye. Her eyes are yellow with multiple red colored rings within them.

title: female_grappler_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon and fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Fighter (dungeon and fighter)|]]. Also known as the Dervish or Ultimate Diva.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/2/2b/GrapplerPortrait.png] has her wearing a luchador-esque [[wrestling_outfit|wrestling outfit]] (the mask being in her left hand) with a [[championship_belt|gold-plated trophy belt]] around her waist. Unlike her other forms, her hair is cut [[short_hair|short]] here.

As an "Ultimate Diva":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/6/6c/UltimateDivaPortrait.png], she has [[dark_skin|dark skin]] and swaps out most of her outfit with a white leather bikini top and gauntlets with free-flowing decorative leather straps. Her hair is a more voluminous version of her base class's, with white [[streaked_hair|highlights]] appearing throughout it.

Her "Neo Grappler":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/c/c9/Full_Neo-_Female_Grappler_Artwork_Uncens.png] form features a more extravagant version of the Ultimate Diva's outfit with gold trimmings. She also has a gold lightning bolt [[tattoo]] under her right eye. Accompanying her are two unnamed wrestlers wearing similar outfits - a blonde with a [[bob_cut|bob cut]] and another with long, black hair.

title: ellin_meiji
body:
Commissioner: 명지남편
Romanization: Myeonggihusband

[[original|Original character]] made by 명지남편. He has made dozens of [[commission]]s of her. 

A [[fox girl]] without a tail. She is a [[female fighter (dungeon and fighter)|fighter]] class, [[female striker (dungeon and fighter)|striker]] subclass awakened [[kaiser (dungeon and fighter)|]] character from the game [[dungeon and fighter|Dungeon Fighter Online]].

She has [[blonde hair]] and a [[ponytail]].

title: female_brawler_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon and fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Fighter (dungeon and fighter)|]]. Also known as the Hellcat or Black Widow.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/b/bc/BrawlerPortrait.png] is similar to her base class, but with spikier hair and scars covering her body. The brick and gauntlets she wields are coated with a purple poison.

As a "Black Widow":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/5/55/BlackWidowPortrait.png], she wears a black jacket and shorts with orange trimmings, wielding different weapons - a claw, throwing knives, and some throwing needles strapped to her thigh. Her hair is now left free-flowing, becoming a [[hime_cut|hime cut]].

Her appearance as a "Neo Brawler":[https://wiki.dfo.world/images/7/79/Full_Neo-_Female_Brawler_Artwork.png] goes for a more punk look, wearing predominantly leather clothing decorated with studs and spikes, with the sole exception being her snakeskin vest.

title: tag_group:legwear
body:
[See [[tag groups]].]

This is the list of tags for legwear (socks, thighhighs, etc.)

There are many types of legwear present in the images hosted on Danbooru. It is expected of you to identify the type of legwear and not just the color when tagging an image.

Doing this helps maintain good tagging standards as well as help those who wish to find images.

h4. Main tags / Legwear by height

* [[socks]]
* [[kneehighs]] (covers the feet and legs up to the knees)
* [[over-kneehighs]] (covers the leg from the foot up to just above the knees)
* [[thighhighs]] (covers the leg from the foot up to the mid-thighs)
* [[pantyhose]] (covers from the waist to the toes)
* [[leggings]] (like pantyhose, but doesn't cover the feet)
** [[detached leggings]] (more like footless thighhighs)

See post #86570 for reference

h4. Additional Detail tags

h6. Specific Color
[i]Note: [code][color]_legwear[/code] tags have been deprecated, please use the specific type of legwear instead[/i]

title: otomachi_una_(talkex)
body:
A speech voicebank released for [[VOCALOID]] [[Otomachi Una]] under the [[TalkEX]] engine. This design was also recycled for her later [[VOICEROID]] voicebank.

She wears a [[school uniform]] with a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] blue and pink [[pleated dress]] with [[black pantyhose|black]] [[plaid pantyhose]]. Her [[eel hat]] and hair is purple instead of the default blue, with the hair ending in a pink [[gradient hair|gradient]].

title: ise_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Ise[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] tied with a red [[hair ribbon]], and [[brown eyes]]. 

Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] comprising a pale [[white kimono]] top, [[black shirt|black undershirt]], [[brown hakama]] tied around the waist with a [[sash]], [[brown socks]], and [[sandals]]. She always wears a [[katana]] at her side. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and bridge to her back, five (or four at kai form) 41 cm twin gun mounts, and a [[radar]] and [[flight deck]] replacing one of her gun turrets at kai form. 

The Ise-class are the poster girls of KanColle Arcade, SEGA's card-based arcade adaptation of the browser game.

h4. Skins

* !post #2910448: Base
* !post #2765227: Kai (with Zuiun Festival happi)
* !post #3158323: [[Ise Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kai Ni]]
* !post #8272449: [[Ise (Kure) (Kancolle)|Kure collab]]

title: f1_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[F1 submachine gun|F1]] [[submachine gun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. Would receive a [[F1 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

A T-Doll full of energy and passion. Known as the "Jungle Poet" due to her keen love in poetry writing, though few truly appreciate her works. She loves heading out on adventures and is always striving to find material and inspiration for her writing.

Voiced by [[Koichi Makoto]] and illustrated by [[Kisetsu]].

body:

title: desert_eagle_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Desert Eagle]] [[handgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Despite her small stature, she possesses incredible strength. She used to be an actress before joining Griffin. She puts a lot of thought into each of her decision, just as she has done with her acting. Once she has locked on to an objective, she will work towards it with exceptional diligence.

Voiced by [[Ogura Yui]] and illustrated by [[Anmi]].

title: python_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the American-made [[Colt Python]] [[revolver]] in the game [[Girls' Frontline]].

Python is a very stylish lady with [[tsurime|sharp]] [[green eyes]], [[long hair|long]], [[messy hair|messy]] [[hair between eyes|hair]] that [[gradient hair|fades]] from [[black hair|black]] to [[blue hair|blue]], a [[mole under eye|mole underneath her left eye]], and [[mole on breast|another on her right breast]]. She also uses [[yellow lips]] and [[yellow nails|yellow]] [[painted nails|nail polish]]. 

She wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[crop top]] and [[white necktie]] under a [[double-breasted]] [[white jacket|white]] [[suit jacket]] that's [[navel|open at the bottom]], [[two-tone gloves|black-and-green]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with [[hip vent]]s, and [[black footwear|black]] [[armored boots|armored]] [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[boots]]. 

Python's equipment and accessories consist of her namesake revolver, a [[holster]] slung on a [[high belt|high-riding]] [[belt]], a [[star pin]] [[lapel pin|on her jacket lapel]], [[arm belt|arm belts]] on [[sleeves pushed up|pushed-up sleeves]], small [[hoop earrings]], two types of [[stud earrings]], a silver [[hair ornament]], and occasionally a green [[lollipop|sucker]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3218317

h4. Skins

* !post #4984173: [[python (hunting time) (girls' frontline)|Hunting Time]]
* !post #7528171: [[python (Beauty in the Graveyard) (girls' frontline)|Beauty in the Graveyard]]

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Python":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Python]
other_names: コルト・パイソン(ドールズフロントライン)
コルト・パイソン(少女前線)

title: ppq_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Walther PPQ]] [[handgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

An austere and ferocious girl with strange habits. She likes to keep things simple - she only enjoys eating one particular type of bread, and her only choice of condiment is salt. She treats everyone the same, which makes her seem a little unapproachable. Her motto is to counter change with constancy, and she always tries to keep all her interpersonal relationships straightforward.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5071971

h4. Skins

* !post #6893624: [[PPQ (Born From Her Fingertips) (girls' frontline)|Born From Her Fingertips]]

* "IOP Wiki: PPQ":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/PPQ]

title: zip.22_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[ZiP 22]] [[handgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

An amateur with an overabundance of confidence, she firmly believes she is one of the elites. She considers herself [[colt revolver (girls' frontline)|SAA]]'s senior and takes good care of her, while unbeknownst to her, she's actually the one being taken care of. When not on duty, she loves dressing up and is especially good at making hand-made jewelry. Contrary to her appearance, she is extremely stubborn and never gives up in combat. Despite her over-protectiveness over her own jewelry, she is a partner that can be completely trusted.

Illustrated by [[Reeh (yukuri130)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4969648

h4. Skins
